subject: [sqlalchemy-20] Provide SQL "case" expression correct input paremeters
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-24 11:48:41.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/ovn_revision_numbers_db.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f42f1cfa69fc3e90f4a3cb47dc2356bb68d43983', 'message': '[sqlalchemy-20] Provide SQL "case" expression correct input paremeters

The "case" expression, as implemented in SQLAlchemy, consists in a set
of tuples of two elements: a column expression and a value. From the
SQLAlchemy "case" signature:
  *whens: Union[
      typing_Tuple[_ColumnExpressionArgument[bool], Any],
      Mapping[Any, Any],
  ],

Closes-Bug: #2012705
Change-Id: I2dfc497f0ac9cb4279cae7f851463c6721bf9d77
'}]
commit_message:
[sqlalchemy-20] Provide SQL "case" expression correct input paremeters

The "case" expression, as implemented in SQLAlchemy, consists in a set
of tuples of two elements: a column expression and a value. From the
SQLAlchemy "case" signature:
  *whens: Union[
      typing_Tuple[_ColumnExpressionArgument[bool], Any],
      Mapping[Any, Any],
  ],

Closes-Bug: #2012705
Change-Id: I2dfc497f0ac9cb4279cae7f851463c6721bf9d77

commit_message:
[Stateless SG] Test fragmented traffic is allowed by stateless SG

This patch adds scenario test to ensure that fragmented traffic can be
send properly between VMs which are using stateless SG.
There is no need to add same test for stateful SG as this is already
covered by various tests in neutron_tempest_plugin.scenario.test_mtu
module.

Change-Id: Id07a2bee283c33aeb083e68599faecec467a9844

commit_message:
Remove munch dependency

This is not maintained and is no longer used by openstacksdk. There are
only three users of the library, one of which is incorrect and the
remainder of which we can easily replace.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iae5b09dc163e8a4e0ed51f065079301b7e4287d3
(cherry picked from commit 6e306cc55018d38b99026d473abf90b2b586f35e)
(cherry picked from commit 50ef00a81724087c500b5a66781591d6a2afd671)

commit_message:
quotas: Add account-level per-policy quotas

Reseller admins can set new headers on accounts like

   X-Account-Quota-Bytes-Policy-<policy-name>: <quota>

This may be done to limit consumption of a faster, all-flash policy, for
example.

This is independent of the existing X-Account-Meta-Quota-Bytes header, which
continues to limit the total storage for an account across all policies.

Change-Id: Ib25c2f667e5b81301f8c67375644981a13487cfe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/82/861282/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from swift.proxy.controllers.base import get_account_info, get_container_info # Object PUT request quota = -1 if quota >= 0: new_size = int(account_info['bytes']) + content_length if quota < new_size: resp = HTTPRequestEntityTooLarge(body='Upload exceeds quota.') if 'swift.authorize' in request.environ: orig_authorize = request.environ['swift.authorize'] def reject_authorize(*args, **kwargs): aresp = orig_authorize(*args, **kwargs) if aresp: return aresp return resp request.environ['swift.authorize'] = reject_authorize else: container_info = get_container_info(request.environ, self.app, swift_source='AQ') if not container_info: return self.app policy_idx = container_info['storage_policy'] sysmeta_key = 'quota-bytes-policy-%s' % policy_idx try: policy_quota = int(account_info['sysmeta'].get(sysmeta_key, -1)) except ValueError: policy_quota = -1 if policy_quota >= 0: policy_stats = account_info['storage_policies'].get(policy_idx, {}) new_size = int(policy_stats.get('bytes', 0)) + content_length print(policy_idx, policy_quota, new_size, policy_stats) if policy_quota < new_size: resp = HTTPRequestEntityTooLarge( body='Upload exceeds policy quota.') if 'swift.authorize' in request.environ: orig_authorize = request.environ['swift.authorize'] def reject_authorize(*args, **kwargs): aresp = orig_authorize(*args, **kwargs) if aresp: return aresp return resp request.environ['swift.authorize'] = reject_authorize else: return resp
deleted_lines: from swift.proxy.controllers.base import get_account_info return self.app if quota < 0: return self.app new_size = int(account_info['bytes']) + content_length if quota < new_size: resp = HTTPRequestEntityTooLarge(body='Upload exceeds quota.') if 'swift.authorize' in request.environ: orig_authorize = request.environ['swift.authorize'] def reject_authorize(*args, **kwargs): aresp = orig_authorize(*args, **kwargs) if aresp: return aresp request.environ['swift.authorize'] = reject_authorize else: return resp

commit_message:
Fix test malicious tarball fail

Since I650fcbc8f773fad8116338f6fb0cf7b4f4f17b33 builds from git fails
on plugins with an exception: 'tarfile.ReadError: not a gzip file'
because the test checks only gzip compressed archives but plugins
created as plain tar files. This change fixes the issue using
transparent compression support and also adds some debug info.

Closes-Bug: #1990432

added_lines: def test_local_directory(self, mock_client): tmpdir = tempfile.mkdtemp() file_name = 'test.txt' file_path = os.path.join(tmpdir, file_name) saved_umask = os.umask(0o077) try: with open(file_path, 'w') as f: f.write('Hello') self.dc = mock_client self.image.plugins = [{ 'name': 'fake-image-base-plugin-test', 'type': 'local', 'enabled': True, 'source': tmpdir} ] push_queue = mock.Mock() builder = tasks.BuildTask(self.conf, self.image, push_queue) builder.run() self.assertTrue(builder.success) except IOError: print('IOError') else: os.remove(file_path) finally: os.umask(saved_umask) os.rmdir(tmpdir) @mock.patch.dict(os.environ, clear=True) @mock.patch('docker.APIClient') archive_name = 'my_archive.tar' file_path = os.path.join(tmpdir, file_name) archive_path = os.path.join(tmpdir, archive_name) # Ensure the file is read/write by the creator only saved_umask = os.umask(0o077) try: with open(file_path, 'w') as f: f.write('Hello') with tarfile.open(archive_path, 'w') as tar: tar.add(file_path, arcname='../test.txt') self.dc = mock_client self.image.plugins = [{ 'name': 'fake-image-base-plugin-test', 'type': 'local', 'enabled': True, 'source': archive_path} ] push_queue = mock.Mock() builder = tasks.BuildTask(self.conf, self.image, push_queue) builder.run() self.assertFalse(builder.success) except IOError: print('IOError') else: os.remove(file_path) os.remove(archive_path) finally: os.umask(saved_umask) os.rmdir(tmpdir) @mock.patch.dict(os.environ, clear=True) @mock.patch('docker.APIClient') def test_malicious_tar_gz(self, mock_client): tmpdir = tempfile.mkdtemp() file_name = 'test.txt'

commit_message:
Fix test malicious tarball fail

Since I650fcbc8f773fad8116338f6fb0cf7b4f4f17b33 builds from git fails
on plugins with an exception: 'tarfile.ReadError: not a gzip file'
because the test checks only gzip compressed archives but plugins
created as plain tar files. This change fixes the issue using
transparent compression support and also adds some debug info.

Closes-Bug: #1990432
Change-Id: If0f9b4dd058a257d0653332d1b663e150c717304
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Michal Nasiadka <mnasiadka@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 143765fb67221cc51f1dc56a41ac2b67dddc453f)

commit_message:
Detect issues with configurations using bridges and VLANs

Change-Id: Ife1e277be468b567fdd13af328d255f9ab9f346c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/03/693403/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: vlan_interfaces: "{{ network_interfaces | net_select_vlans | list }}" - name: Extract names of VLAN interfaces set_fact: vlan_interface_names: "{{ vlan_interfaces | map('net_interface') | select('match', '^.*\\.[0-9]+$') | list }}" - name: Remove .<vlan> suffix set_fact: interfaces_with_vlans: "{{ vlan_interface_names | map('regex_replace', '^(.*)\\.[0-9]+$', '\\1') | unique | list }}" - name: Extract list of bridge ports set_fact: bridge_ports: "{{ bridge_interfaces | map('net_bridge_ports') | flatten | unique | list }}" - name: Detect bridge ports also configured with VLAN interfaces set_fact: bridge_ports_with_vlans: "{{ bridge_ports | intersect(interfaces_with_vlans) }}" - name: Warn if bridge ports are also configured with VLAN interfaces # fail + ignore_errors will print in red but keep going fail: msg: > The following bridge ports are also configured with VLAN interfaces: {{ bridge_ports_with_vlans | join(', ') }}. VLAN interfaces will prevent tagged traffic for these VLANs being forwarded by bridges. See https://docs.openstack.org/kayobe/latest/configuration/network.html#bridges-and-vlans for more details. ignore_errors: yes when: bridge_ports_with_vlans | length > 0

commit_message:
api-ref: describe which protocols are enabled for stateless SG

This behavior matches what ML2/OVS implementation does and what we
intend to implement for ML2/OVN. More than that, a decision was made
during vPTG to make the behavior part of api-ref to facilitate
cross-backend consistency.

Related-Bug: #2006949
Related-Bug: #2009053
Change-Id: Ic633eedd9f0d320d9ad0c27a72f07b1b016d7ba3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/47/878947/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Regardless of rules defined for a stateless security group, the following protocols are expected to work: ARP, DHCP, IPv6 SLAAC / DHCPv6 stateless address configuration, IPv6 Router and Neighbour Discovery. Note: metadata service is not enabled by default. If your workload requires metadata for configuration, make sure to create a security group rule that would allow HTTP replies from the metadata service IP address / port pair.

Change-Id: I7c1c47e287855f32b9d418482965b95212190291

commit_message:
api-ref: add semantics for stateless security group api

Change-Id: I7c1c47e287855f32b9d418482965b95212190291
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/46/878946/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: or stateless security groups for ``ports``. A stateless security group bypasses connection tracking in the underlying firewall, potentially providing performance and simplicity benefits. On the other hand, using stateless security groups adds more complexity to rule definitions: the user now has to explicitly define rules for both directions of a duplex connection, so e.g. two rules have to be defined to allow a TCP flow: one for packets sent from a port and another one for packets received by the port. The existing security groups will all be considered as stateful. Update of the ``stateful`` attribute is allowed when there is no port associated with the security group.
deleted_lines: or stateless security groups for ``ports``. The existing security groups will all be considered as stateful. Update of the ``stateful`` attribute is allowed when there is no port associated with the security group.

added_lines: echo export VM_IP=$(openstack floating ip list -f json | jq -r -c '.[] | select(.Port) | .["Floating IP Address"]' | head -1) > {{ working_dir }}/vm_ip.sh
deleted_lines: echo export VM_IP=$(openstack floating ip list -c 'Floating IP Address' -f json | grep Address | cut -d '"' -f4 | grep "`openstack server list --status ACTIVE -c Networks -f json | grep Networks | cut -d'=' -f2 | sed -e 's/, /\n/g' -e 's/\"//'`" | head -n1) > {{ working_dir }}/vm_ip.sh

in a loop.

The daemon, collect the log of each individual run in a "ccp-<PID>"

commit_message:
Add control plane testing during update.

continous-test.sh is a light shell daemon to start "workload_launch.sh
sanityfast" in a loop.

That daemon collects the log of each individual run in a "ct-<PID>"
directory and the result in control-plane-test-<PID>.log.  The pid
can be found in control-plane-test.pid.

In tripleo-upgrade we add the usual check integration at the relevant
part of the update. The new boolean option
"--update-controlplane-check" is added to the infrared interface.

By default this test is not activated. control_plane_check variable
controls that behavior outside of infrared.

We have two definitions of failure:
- how many successive failures we have;
- how many total failures we have.

This should avoid false positive while still catching long enough cut.

We also activate debug output for the workload launch script to ease
error checking.

Change-Id: Ieff860667cf67a1c1f67221b05575e952a0636fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/79/877779/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- - name: Stop control plane testing. shell: | {{ working_dir }}/control_plane_test_stop.sh when: control_plane_check|bool

subject: Optimize Gnocchi fetcher processing time
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-01-27 17:59:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty/commit/80f8a1ca6208ef0922ae41fb2484c7de8665adcb', 'message': 'Optimize Gnocchi fetcher processing time

Following the footsteps of [1], depending on the environment where
CloudKitty is applied, when using Gnocchi fetcher, if the
environment is considerably big, CloudKitty tends to take too much
time loading the scope IDs from the Gnocchi API. To reduce that
process time, we adopted a different approach to discover the scope
IDs registered in Gnocchi.

This patch proposes a change in that process, bulding on top of [1]
to load the chunk of Gnocchi resources and execute the retrieval of
the scope ID and selecting only the unique ones right away. Then,
in the worst case scenario, we would only have 1000 resources
being loaded to memory. Furthermore, we use the ``search`` API
method from Gnocchi to filter resources that are from scopes that are
not in the set already loaded. Therefore, we do not need to go over all
of the resouces in Gnocchi. We will only list all of the resources that
do not have the scope IDs already loaded.

This reduced the processing time to load scope IDs from about 5
minutes in and the environment with 500 scopes, and about 50
thousand resources to 40 seconds.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cloudkitty/+/864269

Change-Id: I9fa8934c5c857bd0069bb8038423e0126739a310

commit_message:
Optimize Gnocchi fetcher processing time

Following the footsteps of [1], depending on the environment where
CloudKitty is applied, when using Gnocchi fetcher, if the environment is
considerably big, CloudKitty tends to take too much time loading the
scope IDs from the Gnocchi API. To reduce that process time, we adopted
a different approach to discover the scope IDs registered in Gnocchi.

This patch proposes a change in that process, building on top of [1] to
load the chunk of Gnocchi resources and execute the retrieval of the
scope ID and selecting only the unique ones right away. Then, in the
worst case scenario, we would only have 1000 resources being loaded to
memory. Furthermore, we use the ``search`` API method from Gnocchi to
filter resources that are from scopes that are not in the set already
loaded. Therefore, we do not need to go over all of the resources in
Gnocchi. We will only list all of the resources that do not have the
scope IDs already loaded.

This reduced the processing time to load scope IDs from about 5 minutes
to 40 seconds in an environment with 500 scopes and ~50,000 resources.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cloudkitty/+/864269

Change-Id: I9fa8934c5c857bd0069bb8038423e0126739a310
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/35/872035/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- issues: - | Optimize Gnocchi fetcher runtime to avoid taking too long when CloudKitty runs in cloud environments with hundreds of thousands of resources.

commit_message:
Add jsonrpc port to database

Adds the RPC port to the database for the running
RPC service. Later on this is to enable us to
be able to some day enable JSONRPC to connect to the
specific port as opposed to the default.

Change-Id: I3954fce26d175c87acd5131c44de23be136fd624

subject: Ensure redirect-type=bridged not used for geneve networks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-23 15:51:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/354383d836f587c9c199b5efb12af14850795e97', 'message': 'WIP: ensure redirect-type=bridged not used for geneve networks

As part of [1] the redirect-type=bridged flag was enabled by default.
However this have the side effect of also decentralizing N/S traffic
for geneve tenant networks, breaking the VM connectivity on them when
it must be centralized, i.e., when no FIPs are associated to the VMs.

This patch differentiates and only enable that flag when the networks
conected through that router gateway port are of VLAN type.

In addition, to avoid MTU issues for the VLAN networks if there are
also genev networks connected to the same router, we re-take the
approach on [2] to ensure the traffic is centralized but not tunneled

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/875644
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/875676

Change-Id: I25e5ee2cf8daee52221a640faa7ac09679742707

commit_message:
Ensure redirect-type=bridged not used for geneve networks

As part of [1] the redirect-type=bridged flag was enabled by default.
However this have the side effect of also decentralizing N/S traffic
for geneve tenant networks, breaking the VM connectivity on them when
it must be centralized, i.e., when no FIPs are associated to the VMs.

This patch differentiates and only enable that flag when the networks
conected through that router gateway port are of VLAN/FLAT type.

In addition, to avoid MTU issues for the VLAN networks if there are
also geneve networks connected to the same router, we re-take the
approach on [2] to ensure the traffic is centralized but not tunneled

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/875644
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/875676

Closes-Bug: #2012712

Change-Id: I25e5ee2cf8daee52221a640faa7ac09679742707
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/50/878450/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib.exceptions import l3 as l3_exc def check_redirect_type_router_gateway_ports(self): """Check OVN router gateway ports Check for the option "redirect-type=bridged" value for router gateway ports. """ if not self.has_lock: return context = n_context.get_admin_context() cmds = [] gw_ports = self._ovn_client._plugin.get_ports( context, {'device_owner': n_const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_GW}) for gw_port in gw_ports: enable_redirect = False if ovn_conf.is_ovn_distributed_floating_ip(): enable_redirect = True network_ids = {port['network_id'] for port in gw_port} networks = self._plugin.get_networks( context, filters={'id': network_ids}) # NOTE(ltomasbo): For VLAN type networks connected through # the gateway port there is a need to set the redirect-type # option to bridge to ensure traffic is not centralized # through the controller. # If there are no VLAN type networks attached we need to # still make it centralized. for net in networks: if net.get(pnet.NETWORK_TYPE) != n_const.TYPE_VLAN: enable_redirect = False break lrp_name = utils.ovn_lrouter_port_name(gw_port['id']) lrp = self._nb_idl.get_lrouter_port(lrp_name) redirect_value = lrp.options.get( ovn_const.LRP_OPTIONS_REDIRECT_TYPE) if enable_redirect: if (not redirect_value or redirect_value != ovn_const.BRIDGE_REDIRECT_TYPE): opt = {ovn_const.LRP_OPTIONS_REDIRECT_TYPE: ovn_const.BRIDGE_REDIRECT_TYPE} cmds.append(self._nb_idl.db_set( 'Logical_Router_Port', lrp_name, ('options', opt))) else: if redirect_value: cmds.append(self._nb_idl.db_remove( 'Logical_Router_Port', lrp_name, ('options', ovn_const.LRP_OPTIONS_REDIRECT_TYPE))) if cmds: with self._nb_idl.transaction(check_error=True) as txn: for cmd in cmds: txn.add(cmd) # A static spacing value is used here, but this method will only run # once per lock due to the use of periodics.NeverAgain(). @periodics.periodic(spacing=600, run_immediately=True) for rp in router_ports: expected_value = 'true' if ovn_conf.is_ovn_distributed_floating_ip(): expected_value = 'false' try: r_ports = self._get_router_ports(context, rp['device_id']) except l3_exc.RouterNotFound: LOG.debug("No Router %s not found", rp['device_id']) else: network_ids = {port['network_id'] for port in r_ports} networks = self._ovn_client._plugin.get_networks( context, filters={'id': network_ids}) for net in networks: if net.get(pnet.NETWORK_TYPE) != n_const.TYPE_VLAN: # NOTE(ltomasbo): not all the networks connected # to the router are of vlan type, so we won't set # the redirect-type=bridged on the router gateway # port, therefore we need to centralized the vlan # traffic to avoid tunneling expected_value = 'true' break

commit_message:
Fix test malicious tarball fail

Since I650fcbc8f773fad8116338f6fb0cf7b4f4f17b33 builds from git fails
on plugins with an exception: 'tarfile.ReadError: not a gzip file'
because the test checks only gzip compressed archives but plugins
created as plain tar files. This change fixes the issue using
transparent compression support and also adds some debug info.

Closes-Bug: #1990432
Change-Id: If0f9b4dd058a257d0653332d1b663e150c717304
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Michal Nasiadka <mnasiadka@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 143765fb67221cc51f1dc56a41ac2b67dddc453f)

commit_message:
Optimizing SQL queries that filter on a time range

Queries filtering on date fields are slow as they have to parse each
row. There are sometimes millions of rows to parse while only a few
thousands are necessary.

The following patch narrows data to process by filtering more on
frame_model.begin as a firtst step using a `BETWEEN` statement instead
of >=

Change-Id: I8acbc8946d9e001419f7bf5064fcebe0a0ae907a

commit_message:
Support customizing arguments of install commands

This introduces the capability to customize arguments of the commands
used to install tempest from source.

Change-Id: I7bb63743a96cf97f6c658c0680d3066cd43ecd52
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tempest refs/changes/41/879241/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context 'with virtualenv arguments' do let :params do { :setup_venv => true, :venv_args => '-c u-c.txt' } end it 'sets up virtualenv for tempest' do is_expected.to contain_exec('setup-venv').with( :command => "virtualenv -p python3 /var/lib/tempest/.venv && /var/lib/tempest/.venv/bin/#{platform_params[:pip_command]} install -U -r requirements.txt -c u-c.txt", :cwd => '/var/lib/tempest', :unless => 'test -d /var/lib/tempest/.venv', :path => ['/bin', '/usr/bin', '/usr/local/bin'] ) end end

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-04-03 08:05:57.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-9.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts/commit/753c1616740205573a6e6c4968e7767f97668ec5', 'message': "Fix package exclude condition for rdo-deps

In [1] I;'ve accidentally missed round brackets which make ternary

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts/+/878929

Change-Id: I6fbac1207f7c5932f7f4671fb50f3d8f5baf6cf2

commit_message:
Fix package exclude condition for rdo-deps

In [1] I;'ve accidentally missed round brackets which make ternary
filter test wrong value, so it always results in False

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts/+/878929

Change-Id: I6fbac1207f7c5932f7f4671fb50f3d8f5baf6cf2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts refs/changes/72/879272/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: exclude: "{{ (ansible_facts['distribution'] == 'Rocky') | ternary(['*rdo-openvswitch*3.1*', '*rdo-ovn*3.1*'], omit) }}"

commit_message:
[sqlalchemy-20] Do not use strings for aatribute names in loader options

The method ``get_l3_agents_by_router_ids`` is retrieving the
``RouterL3AgentBinding`` registers along with the ``Agent`` information.
This left outer join should be explictly defined using the database
model.

Expected query:
  SELECT routerl3agentbindings.router_id AS ...
  FROM routerl3agentbindings
  LEFT OUTER JOIN agents ON agents.id = routerl3agentbindings.l3_agent_id
  WHERE routerl3agentbindings.router_id IN (XXX)

Closes-Bug: #2012662
Change-Id: Ife9ba5d774934d2cd1a86b3281b78e854d88de3c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/80/878480/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: query = query.outerjoin(agent_model.Agent) query = query.filter(

subject: [compute] always set instance.host in post_livemigration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-11-08 19:05:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/83db87dd0ff753a9f11333580d35dc23b7f673c5', 'message': '[compute] always set instance.host in post_livemigration

This change add a new _post_live_migration_update_host
function that wraps _post_live_migration and just ensures
that if we exit due to an exception instance.host is set
to the destination host.

when we are in _post_live_migration the guest has already
started running on the destination host and we cannot revert.
Sometimes admins or users will hard reboot the instance expecting
that to fix everything when the vm enters the error state after
the failed migrations. Previously this would end up recreating the
instance on the source node leading to possible data corruption if
the instance used shared storage.

Change-Id: Ibc4bc7edf1c8d1e841c72c9188a0a62836e9f153
Partial-Bug: #1628606

This change add a new _post_live_migration_update_host
function that wraps _post_live_migration and just ensures
that if we exit due to an exception instance.host is set
to the destination host.

when we are in _post_live_migration the guest has already
started running on the destination host and we cannot revert.
Sometimes admins or users will hard reboot the instance expecting
that to fix everything when the vm enters the error state after
the failed migrations. Previously this would end up recreating the
instance on the source node leading to possible data corruption if
the instance used shared storage.

commit_message:
[compute] always set instance.host in post_livemigration

This change add a new _post_live_migration_update_host
function that wraps _post_live_migration and just ensures
that if we exit due to an exception instance.host is set
to the destination host.

when we are in _post_live_migration the guest has already
started running on the destination host and we cannot revert.
Sometimes admins or users will hard reboot the instance expecting
that to fix everything when the vm enters the error state after
the failed migrations. Previously this would end up recreating the
instance on the source node leading to possible data corruption if
the instance used shared storage.

NOTE(auniyal): Differences from ussuri to train
  * nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py
  * Added instance.migration_context value to None, as fake_instance do not have this property in train

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/99/876199/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_json_data(data): """Check if the binary data is JSON and parse it if so. Only supports dictionaries. """ # The data can be quite large, we don't want to simply loads() it. # In my testing, doing so is 1000 times (!!) slower than this process. for idx in range(len(data)): char = data[idx:idx + 1] if char.isspace(): continue if char != b'{' or char != 'b[': return None # not JSON, at least not JSON we care about break # maybe JSON try: return json.loads(data) except ValueError: return None

commit_message:
Update after ops_sunbeam configure_charm changes

* Use default configure_charm and specialise init_container_services
  to remove duplicate code
* Stop using deprecated use_juju_for_storage=True
* Update identity_service library to v1.0
* Update CinderCephOperatorCharm  super class after update in
  ops_sunbeam.

Change-Id: I815cb1dd22488a7c233864d64bd61e0d742cb368
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-cinder-ceph-k8s refs/changes/54/876954/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import ops_sunbeam.guard as sunbeam_guard if self.bootstrapped(): def init_container_services(self): """Setp ceph keyring and init pebble handlers that are ready.""" else: logging.debug( f"Not running init for {ph.service_name}," " container not ready" ) raise sunbeam_guard.WaitingExceptionError( "Payload container not ready" ) super().init_container_services() main(CinderCephOperatorCharm)
deleted_lines: from ops.model import ( ActiveStatus, ) if self._state.bootstrapped: def configure_charm(self, event) -> None: """Catchall handler to cconfigure charm services.""" if not self.relation_handlers_ready(): logging.debug("Deferring configuration, charm relations not ready") return for ph in self.pebble_handlers: if not ph.service_ready: logging.debug("Deferring, container service not ready") return # Add healthchecks to the plan for ph in self.pebble_handlers: ph.add_healthchecks() self.unit.status = ActiveStatus() main(CinderCephOperatorCharm, use_juju_for_storage=True)

commit_message:
Retire the stable/focal git branch.

This (stable) branch was cut originally to support the
mysql-innodb-cluster charm with the "20.04" base, although due to a
series of events to simplify the management it was decided to use the
stable/jammy git branch to source the `8.0` charmhub track and provide a
charm capable of running on "20.04" and "22.04".

Change-Id: I3e0e6a3f0e99f59d98778298d56e72bbfa837b80
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-mysql-innodb-cluster refs/changes/15/877415/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add LimitRequestBody configuration for Horizon

Since CVE-2022-29404 is fixed [1,2] the default value for the
LimitRequestBody directive in the Apache HTTP Server has been changed
from 0 (unlimited) to 1 GiB. This limits the size of images (for
example) uploaded in Horizon. This change add the ability to
configure the limit.

1. https://access.redhat.com/articles/6975397
2. https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2022-29404

Closes-Bug: #2012588
Change-Id: I4cd9dd088cbcf38ff6f8d188ebcc56be7d9ea1c9
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/16/878416/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- security: - | Since CVE-2022-29404 is fixed the default value for the LimitRequestBody directive in the Apache HTTP Server has been changed from 0 (unlimited) to 1 GiB. This limits the size of images (for example) uploaded in Horizon. Now this limit can be configured via ``horizon_httpd_limitrequestbody`` variable in the Horizon or via ``kolla_httpd_limitrequestbody`` globally. By default the value is set to 1073741824 (1 GiB) as recommended. `LP#2012588 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/2012588>`__

intermediate entities like orders and containers, yet returns to the
API caller only IDs of created secrets.

As a result, the API consumer is not aware of those entities and the
fact that they have to be deleted as well when secrets are deleted.
This leads to orders and containers piling up, and also the deleted

commit_message:
Cleanup intermediate orders and containers

when creating keys or keypairs with Barbican, castellan creates
intermediate entities like orders and containers, yet returns to the
API caller only IDs of created secrets.

As a result, the API consumer is not aware of those entities and the
fact that they have to be deleted as well when secrets are deleted.
This leads to orders and containers piling up, and also the deleted
secrets can not be purged from DB as they are still being referenced
by not deleted containers and orders. This is especially pronounced
when the API caller is actually some other OpenStack service, so the
user may not even be aware that Barbican was involved in the first
place.

This patch attempts to delete those intermediate entities before
returning the secret IDs to the caller. For the sake of backward
compatibility, and to account for a fact that with default Barbican
policies, not every user who can create order can delete it too,
any errors on such attempts are ignored and only logged as warnings.

Closes-Bug: 1638018
Change-Id: Icdaa44a29fdc59fce107078bff3a7544beb2b3c7

commit_message:
Fix floating ip selection

The floating ip selection didn't count with possibility of
stopped workloads on the environment. We now list running hosts
and join them against available virtual ips.

Co-authored-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7d46100eccf43159f47e620d14fae3b66701a4d9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/32/874832/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo export VM_IP=$(openstack floating ip list -c 'Floating IP Address' -f json | jq '.[]."Floating IP Address"' | grep "`openstack server list --status ACTIVE -c Networks -f json | jq '.[0]."Networks"[][]'`") > {{ working_dir }}/vm_ip.sh
deleted_lines: echo export VM_IP=$(openstack floating ip list -f json | jq -r -c '.[] | select(.Port) | .["Floating IP Address"]' | head -1) > {{ working_dir }}/vm_ip.sh

added_lines: class PeerKeyStore: """Store private key sercret id in peer storage relation.""" def __init__(self, relation, unit): self.relation = relation self.unit = unit def store_ready(self) -> bool: """Check if store is ready.""" return bool(self.relation) def get_private_key(self) -> bool: """Return private key.""" return self.relation.data[self.unit].get("private_key") def set_private_key(self, value: str): """Update private key.""" self.relation.data[self.unit]["private_key"] = value class LocalDBKeyStore: """Store private key sercret id in local unit db. This is a fallback for when the peer relation is not present. """ def __init__(self, state_db): self.state_db = state_db try: self.state_db.private_key except AttributeError: self.state_db.private_key = None def store_ready(self) -> bool: """Check if store is ready.""" return True def get_private_key(self) -> str: """Return private key.""" return self.state_db.private_key def set_private_key(self, value: str): """Update private key.""" self.state_db.private_key = value store=None, try: self.store = self.PeerKeyStore( self.model.get_relation("peers"), self.charm.model.unit ) except KeyError: self.store = self.LocalDBKeyStore(charm._state) """Configure event handlers for tls relation.""" if not self.store.store_ready(): if self.store.get_private_key(): # Secret already saved self.store.set_private_key(private_key_secret.id) if not self.store.store_ready(): private_key_secret_id = self.store.get_private_key() private_key_secret_id = self.store.get_private_key()
deleted_lines: """Configure event handlers for peer relation.""" peer_relation = self.model.get_relation("peers") if not peer_relation: if "private_key" in peer_relation.data[self.charm.model.unit]: # Secret already saved in peer_relation peer_relation.data[self.charm.model.unit].update( { "private_key": private_key_secret.id, } ) peer_relation = self.model.get_relation("peers") if not peer_relation: private_key_secret_id = peer_relation.data[self.charm.model.unit].get( "private_key" ) peer_relation = self.model.get_relation("peers") private_key_secret_id = peer_relation.data[self.charm.model.unit].get( "private_key" )

commit_message:
Do not add bracket for IPv6 addresses in no_proxy

IPv6 addresses in no_proxy environment should NOT be surrounded by [],
otherwise the addresses are just ignored.

Resolves: rhbz#2180677
Change-Id: I1b7c9a671078d93ff272d3feef053c1208ab9088

commit_message:
Fix unit tests for plugin package management

- The whole test cases were ignored

- python3-aodh-tests resource is never declared

- available packages are different according to operating system

- neutron_available toggles only the neutron-tempest-plugin package and
  does not affect the packages for optional pluginske l2gw.

Change-Id: I83bc0d6bbd62d19b17d1bbe2ff5eb434fdd26828
(cherry picked from commit 966aa2449bb6faff4d696be7617d5fcfeda62dda)
(cherry picked from commit aa2c23c7eeebffa26547ce25173ded4b428e58b3)

added_lines: let :params do { :configure_images => false, :manage_tests_packages => true } context 'with when managing tests packages for keystone (required service)' do it "should install keystone tests package" do is_expected.to contain_package('python-keystone-tests') is_expected.to_not contain_package('python-sahara-tests-tempest') before :each do params.merge!({ :sahara_available => true }) it "should install sahara tests package" do if platform_params[:python_sahara_tests] is_expected.to contain_package('python-sahara-tests-tempest') end before :each do params.merge!({ :neutron_available => true, :public_network_id => '4c423fc6-87f7-4e6d-9d3c-abc13058ae5b' }) it "should install neutron and *aas tests packages" do if platform_params[:python_neutron_tests] is_expected.to contain_package('python-neutron-tests') end is_expected.to_not contain_package('python-neutron-vpnaas-tests') is_expected.to_not contain_package('python-neutron-dynamic-routing-tests') is_expected.to_not contain_package('python-networking-l2gw-tests-tempest') { :dev_packages => ['python3-dev', 'libxslt1-dev', 'libxml2-dev', 'libssl-dev', 'libffi-dev', 'patch', 'gcc', 'python3-virtualenv', 'python3-pip' ], :package_name => 'tempest', :pip_command => 'pip3', :python_keystone_tests => 'keystone-tempest-plugin', :python_neutron_tests => 'neutron-tempest-plugin', :python_sahara_tests => false } { :dev_packages => ['python3-devel', 'libxslt-devel', 'libxml2-devel', 'openssl-devel', 'libffi-devel', 'patch', 'gcc'], :package_name => 'openstack-tempest', :pip_command => 'pip3', :python_keystone_tests => 'python3-keystone-tests-tempest', :python_neutron_tests => 'python3-neutron-tests-tempest', :python_sahara_tests => 'python3-sahara-tests-tempest' } if facts[:operatingsystem] != 'Ubuntu' it_behaves_like 'tempest with plugins packages' end

commit_message:
Create octavia multi-vCPU flavor

Candidate for backport to Wallaby.

Creates a new Nova flavor, an Octavia flavorprofile and a Octavia flavor
that can be used for creating loadbalancers.
This can boost the network throughput when using Amphorae with
multiple vCPUs.

Depends-on: Id6b31143939067327011c346b3f1361902acabcf
Change-Id: I925a0403899aff881816c4903998e369acfab71f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/78/865178/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: create nova multiqueue flavor for Octavia shell: | if ! openstack flavor show octavia_{{ octavia_flavor_id }} > /dev/null; then openstack flavor create -vv \ --id {{ octavia_multiqueue_flavor_properties.nova_flavor_id }} \ --ram {{ octavia_multiqueue_flavor_properties.ram }} \ --disk {{ octavia_multiqueue_flavor_properties.disk }} \ --vcpus {{ octavia_multiqueue_flavor_properties.vcpus }} \ --property hw:vif_multiqueue_enabled=true \ --private \ octavia_{{ octavia_multiqueue_flavor_properties.nova_flavor_id }} fi run_once: true when: octavia_manage_nova_flavor | default(false) | bool - name: create octavia multiqueue flavor profile shell: | if ! openstack loadbalancer flavorprofile show {{ octavia_multiqueue_flavor_properties.flavorprofile_name }} > /dev/null; then openstack loadbalancer flavorprofile create -vv \ --name {{ octavia_multiqueue_flavor_properties.flavorprofile_name }} \ --provider amphora --flavor-data \ '{"loadbalancer_topology": "ACTIVE_STANDBY", "compute_flavor": "{{ octavia_multiqueue_flavor_properties.nova_flavor_id }}"}' fi run_once: true when: octavia_manage_nova_flavor | default(false) | bool - name: create octavia multiqueue flavor shell: | if ! openstack loadbalancer flavor show {{ octavia_multiqueue_flavor_properties.flavor_name }} > /dev/null; then openstack loadbalancer flavor create -vv \ --name {{ octavia_multiqueue_flavor_properties.flavor_name }} \ --flavorprofile {{ octavia_multiqueue_flavor_properties.flavorprofile_name }} \ --description "Amphora flavor with NIC multiqueue support enabled." --enable fi run_once: true when: octavia_manage_nova_flavor | default(false) | bool

commit_message:
Fix base class for ovn charms

The charm classes were reworked to support k8s and machine charms
as part of this OSBaseOperatorCharm no longer contains k8s
components. However the k8s ovn charms have their own charm class
OSBaseOVNOperatorCharm which is for ovn k8s services so should
be based in OSBaseOperatorCharmk8s

Change-Id: Ieb43eb22c8c91c7b6776b3d309e244578d4d7c13

commit_message:
Add workaround for announce mail script

Somewhere between today and March 23rd, 2023, pbr started to print a
log.info line when we try to fetch a package's name from setup.py, e.g:

$ python3 setup.py --name 2>/dev/null
[pbr] Generating ChangeLog
openstack_releases

A workaround is now added to our announce script to avoid garbled
announce mails [1].

[1] https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-announce/2023-March/014246.html

Change-Id: I6233bb8d12a12efd3cb02abd29d8d43d7fd91da2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/65/879065/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(elod.illes): pbr startid to print '[pbr] Generating ChangeLog' # this is related to some recent release (setuptools? virtualenv?) # the 'tail' command needs to be removed as soon as that bug is fixed project_name=$(python setup.py --name | tail -1) description="$(python setup.py --description| tail -1)"

commit_message:
[update] add validation package update during undercloud prerequisites update

Update pre validation stage requires latest validation packages to reside on undercloud

This must be done after undercloud repo is updated and before undercloud is updated.

Closes: OSP-23621

Change-Id: I884d5c780685f6ea46b7b0afa34e5c4f038ae68b

commit_message:

... instead of exec, as the built in functionality is enough to
avoid overriding the file and generally file resource is preferred
approach to manage a file.

subject: Check whether a directory specific for this OS flavour (release+version) exists, and use that to pull the list of packages from, if available. Debian release version numbers consist of two numbers, <major>.<point>. For the current version of Stretch, at the point of this writing, the number is "9.5". The algorithm first tries to find a directory called "debs-Debian-9.5", then "debs-Debian-9", and then "debs". If one of these directories exists, it needs to contain the packages lists. For Ubuntu, the package lists are all in "debs".

"debs-Debian-9", and then "debs". If one of these
directories exists, it needs to contain the packages
lists. For Ubuntu, the package lists are all in

As a side effect, package lists may now be completely
independent on a per-release basis, so this patch also
installs "build-essential" instead of just gcc and g++.

Also, the package fixes the authentication problem in

'}]
commit_message:
Check whether a directory specific for this OS flavour
(release+version) exists, and use that to pull the list
of packages from, if available. Debian release version
numbers consist of two numbers, <major>.<point>. For
the current version of Stretch, at the point of this
writing, the number is "9.5". The algorithm first tries
to find a directory called "debs-Debian-9.5", then
"debs-Debian-9", and then "debs". If one of these
directories exists, it needs to contain the packages
lists. For Ubuntu, the package lists are all in
"debs".

As a side effect, package lists may now be completely
independent on a per-release basis, so this patch also
installs "build-essential" instead of just gcc and g++.

Also, the package fixes the authentication problem in
Debian, as the code always assumes a TCP connection to
the database, but the standard Debian setup is to only
allow a Unix domain socket for management purposes.

Co-Authored-By: j.harbott@x-ion.de
Change-Id: I854d6d0e870a8c18a32353ab3fb20e440fb94969

subject: Allow single or multiple spaces in sedding neutron's policy file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-02 09:46:27.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron-legacy'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/8ddc7beee5fb21869db90570fd3b3f3eeb22c398', 'message': 'Allow single or multiple spaces in sedding neutron's policy file

In neutron's policy file, the "'context_is_admin':  'role:admin'" rule
has tow spaces after the ':' and there usually is a single space.

There is no problem if the we don't modify the policy file. However,
new oslo policy aims to maintain policy in code, and there is only a
space after the ':' in the policy file genarated by oslo policy, which
will cause tests failure of most neutron gate. Therefore, we should
make sure the sed rule can replace the policy including only one space.

Change-Id: I279b09d0178edb54bb9b988b179754e75ed87361
'}]
commit_message:
Allow single or multiple spaces in sedding neutron's policy file

In neutron's policy file, the "'context_is_admin':  'role:admin'" rule
has tow spaces after the ':' and there usually is a single space.

There is no problem if the we don't modify the policy file. However,
new oslo policy aims to maintain policy in code, and there is only a
space after the ':' in the policy file genarated by oslo policy, which
will cause tests failure of most neutron gate. Therefore, we should
make sure the sed rule can replace the policy including only one space.

Change-Id: I279b09d0178edb54bb9b988b179754e75ed87361
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/67/440267/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sed -i 's/"context_is_admin":[ ]*"role:admin"/"context_is_admin": "role:admin or user_name:neutron"/g' $Q_POLICY_FILE

commit_message:
Cap virtualenv (<20.18.0) to unblock gate

With latest virtualenv (and setuptools bundled in it) py3*-check-uc
jobs started to fail as pkg_resources' __getattr__ breaks on multiple
packages' metadata.

Release is very close and library release upper constraints bumping
patches are piling up. This patch is a workaround only to unblock the
gate and need to be reverted as soon as the py3*-check-uc jobs works
well with the latest virtualenv and setuptools releases.

Change-Id: I36ae32a401844bf5a5df0d20d3f88f24b2a0cf8e

commit_message:
Add EPEL GPG key for RHEL 9

We've missed adding a GPG key that's required for installing
packages for RHEL9 distros from EPEL.

Change-Id: I2bef98a695517c038cb9f0dcd09caa16611520b7
Closes-Bug: #2013276

commit_message:
Add thrift to includepkgs from EPEL

Latest ceph releases also require thrift package to be installed,
which is provided by EPEL. We add the package of allowed ones
to come from EPEL.

Change-Id: Id2cd34bf88efbda9ba37710d1052a6f54249b5bf
Closes-Bug: #2013276
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ceph_client refs/changes/82/879082/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: includepkgs: 'lttng-ust*, userspace-rcu, libbabeltrace, leveldb, liboath, fmt, thrift'
deleted_lines: includepkgs: 'lttng-ust*, userspace-rcu, libbabeltrace, leveldb, liboath, fmt'

commit_message:
[WIP] WSGI Neutron integration

This patch provides a new mechanism to deploy Neutron using WSGI
script.

Partial-Bug: #1666779
Change-Id: I49d60d71c7a5d0b0d2f6b916927e7d53ea6521a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/91/439191/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Listen %PUBLICPORT% LogFormat "%h %l %u %t \"%r\" %>s %b \"%{Referer}i\" \"%{User-agent}i\" %D(us)" neutron_combined <Directory %NEUTRON_BIN%> Require all granted </Directory> <VirtualHost *:%PUBLICPORT%> WSGIDaemonProcess neutron-server processes=5 threads=1 user=%USER% display-name=%{GROUP} %VIRTUALENV% WSGIProcessGroup neutron-server WSGIScriptAlias / %NEUTRON_BIN%/neutron-api WSGIApplicationGroup %{GLOBAL} WSGIPassAuthorization On ErrorLogFormat "%M" ErrorLog /var/log/%APACHE_NAME%/neutron.log CustomLog /var/log/%APACHE_NAME%/neutron_access.log neutron_combined %SSLENGINE% %SSLCERTFILE% %SSLKEYFILE% </VirtualHost> %SSLLISTEN%<VirtualHost *:443> %SSLLISTEN% %SSLENGINE% %SSLLISTEN% %SSLCERTFILE% %SSLLISTEN% %SSLKEYFILE% %SSLLISTEN%</VirtualHost> Alias /networking %NEUTRON_BIN%/neutron-api <Location /identity> SetHandler wsgi-script Options +ExecCGI WSGIProcessGroup neutron-server WSGIApplicationGroup %{GLOBAL} WSGIPassAuthorization On </Location>

commit_message:
Update devstack to support Fedora 32

Currently supported releases for Fedora are
Fedora 31 and Fedora 32. More information in
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/End_of_life.

This change updates stack.sh so we can Devstack
on Fedora 32 without setting the FORCE=yes env
variable.

Change-Id: I6226258a6f1bff2d1dae40325d2c18c5ee0c5ba6

commit_message:
Require that service tokens have the service role

The intent of the X-Service-Token inter-service communications is that
only a service account such as nova, cinder etc should be submitting the
service token. To do this we have to validate that the token that is
transmitted should have the service role.

Change-Id: Ia35c262f59a61fd6405533fe17cda154c9c4073d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/64/506964/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # only tokens with the service role should be accepted as service tokens iniset $conf_file $section service_token_roles_required "true" iniset $conf_file $section service_token_roles "service"

commit_message:
[WIP] Force OVS brige to have MAC of slave port

Our DSVM does not have the same MAC address as it's slave. This
seems to be breaking our ironic jobs. Testing this change out.

Change-Id: If72c4f79a5a25ef3a9bbdf526dde995fbbf545fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/50/400950/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Enable devstack to optionally install mysql-cluster
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-01 21:45:05.000000000', 'files': ['lib/cinder', 'lib/neutron', 'lib/nova', 'lib/keystone', 'lib/glance', 'lib/databases/mysql-cluster'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/aee4b458d6529b04facaa6a725750bd8092864c7', 'message': "Enable devstack to optionally install mysql-cluster

This change will allow a devstack deployment to optionally install
mysql-cluster.

To enable mysql-cluster, you will need to update devstack's local.conf
file. The changes needed in local.conf are:

  Change: DATABASE_TYPE=mysql-cluster
  Add: mysql-cluster to ENABLED_SERVICES
  Remove: mysql from ENABLED_SERVICES

There are two environmental variables that can be used to point to the
mysql-cluster repository and the version to be used. If they are not
specified, the default values are used.

  MYSQL_CLUSTER_REPO_URL (default value is http://repo.mysql.com/apt/ubuntu)

  MYSQL_CLUSTER_VERSION (default value is mysql-cluster-7.5)

Currently, mysql-cluster devstack deployment has only been tested on Ubuntu
16.04 on a single node.

Implements: blueprint mysql-cluster-support
"}]
commit_message:
Enable devstack to optionally install mysql-cluster

This change will allow a devstack deployment to optionally install
mysql-cluster.

To enable mysql-cluster, you will need to update devstack's local.conf
file. The changes needed in local.conf are:

  Change: DATABASE_TYPE=mysql-cluster
  Add: mysql-cluster to ENABLED_SERVICES
  Remove: mysql from ENABLED_SERVICES

There are two environmental variables that can be used to point to the
mysql-cluster repository and the version to be used. If they are not
specified, the default values are used.

  MYSQL_CLUSTER_REPO_URL (default value is http://repo.mysql.com/apt/ubuntu)

  MYSQL_CLUSTER_VERSION (default value is mysql-cluster-7.5)

Currently, mysql-cluster devstack deployment has only been tested on Ubuntu
16.04 on a single node.

Depends-On: I49ca3906df78c3cfbad4012bcdf777f701c69382
Depends-On: I597d6ab50fe117e725f1d8de9b359ac9fbb79eb3
Depends-On: Idf6e1f65ddb07e85ce864477aead976fd9a6af27
Depends-On: I06e08a7d0788606143cb9d5a500ca6bb36c907a0
Depends-On: Id717406bdb34bec20c57ae9ae0e50607738fb91d
Change-Id: I95525e63c073eb4fc8f3b1092d371af5a6e008cb
Implements: blueprint mysql-cluster-support
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/98/565598/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # lib/databases/mysql # Functions to control the configuration and operation of the **MySQL** database backend # Dependencies: # # - DATABASE_{HOST,USER,PASSWORD} must be defined # Save trace setting _XTRACE_DB_MYSQL=$(set +o | grep xtrace) set +o xtrace MYSQL_DRIVER=${MYSQL_DRIVER:-PyMySQL} register_database mysql-cluster MYSQL_SERVICE_NAME=mysql # Functions # --------- function get_database_type_mysql-cluster { if [[ "$MYSQL_DRIVER" == "PyMySQL" ]]; then echo mysql+pymysql else echo mysql fi } # Get rid of everything enough to cleanly change database backends function cleanup_database_mysql-cluster { stop_service mysql $MYSQL_SERVICE_NAME stop_mysql_cluster if is_ubuntu; then # Get ruthless with mysql apt_get purge -y mysql* mariadb* sudo rm -rf /var/lib/mysql-cluster sudo rm -rf /etc/mysql sudo rm -rf /usr/local/mysql/data # remove the mysql-cluster repo for apt local mysql_url=${MYSQL_CLUSTER_REPO_URL:-http://repo.mysql.com/apt/ubuntu/} sudo apt-add-repository --remove "$mysql_url" elif is_oraclelinux; then uninstall_package mysql-community-server uninstall_package mysql-cluster-community-data-node uninstall_package cluster-community-management-server fi sudo rm -rf /var/lib/mysql-cluster sudo rm -rf /var/lib/mysql } function recreate_database_mysql-cluster { local db=$1 mysql -u$DATABASE_USER -p$DATABASE_PASSWORD -h$MYSQL_HOST -e "DROP DATABASE IF EXISTS $db;" mysql -u$DATABASE_USER -p$DATABASE_PASSWORD -h$MYSQL_HOST -e "CREATE DATABASE $db CHARACTER SET utf8;" } function configure_database_mysql-cluster { local my_conf mysql slow_log echo_summary "Configuring and starting MySQL" my_conf=$(get_my_conf) # mysql-community-server does not start after installation, even on ubuntu. Start it up here. start_service $MYSQL_SERVICE_NAME # Set the root password - only works the first time. For Ubuntu, we already # did that with debconf before installing the package, but we still try, # because the package might have been installed already. sudo mysqladmin -u root password $DATABASE_PASSWORD || true # Update the DB to give user '$DATABASE_USER'@'%' full control of the all databases: sudo mysql -uroot -p$DATABASE_PASSWORD -h127.0.0.1 -e "GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON *.* TO '$DATABASE_USER'@'%' identified by '$DATABASE_PASSWORD';" # Now update ``my.cnf`` for some local needs and restart the mysql service # Change bind-address from localhost (127.0.0.1) to any (::) and # set default db type to InnoDB iniset -sudo $my_conf mysqld bind-address "$SERVICE_LISTEN_ADDRESS" iniset -sudo $my_conf mysqld sql_mode TRADITIONAL iniset -sudo $my_conf mysqld max_connections 1024 iniset -sudo $my_conf mysqld query_cache_type OFF iniset -sudo $my_conf mysqld query_cache_size 0 if [[ "$DATABASE_QUERY_LOGGING" == "True" ]]; then echo_summary "Enabling MySQL query logging" if is_fedora; then slow_log=/var/log/mariadb/mariadb-slow.log else slow_log=/var/log/mysql/mysql-slow.log fi sudo sed -e '/log.slow.queries/d' \ -e '/long.query.time/d' \ -e '/log.queries.not.using.indexes/d' \ -i $my_conf # Turn on slow query log, log all queries (any query taking longer than # 0 seconds) and log all non-indexed queries iniset -sudo $my_conf mysqld slow-query-log 1 iniset -sudo $my_conf mysqld slow-query-log-file $slow_log iniset -sudo $my_conf mysqld long-query-time 0 iniset -sudo $my_conf mysqld log-queries-not-using-indexes 1 fi restart_service $MYSQL_SERVICE_NAME } function install_database_mysql-cluster { if is_ubuntu; then # Seed configuration with mysql password so that apt-get install doesn't # prompt us for a password upon install. sudo debconf-set-selections <<MYSQL_PRESEED mysql-cluster-community-server mysql-cluster-community-server/root-pass password $DATABASE_PASSWORD mysql-cluster-community-server mysql-cluster-community-server/re-root-pass password $DATABASE_PASSWORD MYSQL_PRESEED fi # while ``.my.cnf`` is not needed for OpenStack to function, it is useful # as it allows you to access the mysql databases via ``mysql nova`` instead # of having to specify the username/password each time. if [[ ! -e $HOME/.my.cnf ]]; then cat <<EOF >$HOME/.my.cnf [client] user=$DATABASE_USER password=$DATABASE_PASSWORD host=$MYSQL_HOST EOF chmod 0600 $HOME/.my.cnf fi # Install mysql-cluster if is_ubuntu || is_oraclelinux; then if is_ubuntu; then # Add the mysql-cluster repo for apt local mysql_url=${MYSQL_CLUSTER_REPO_URL:-http://repo.mysql.com/apt/ubuntu/} local mysql_version=${MYSQL_CLUSTER_VERSION:-mysql-cluster-7.5} sudo apt-add-repository "$mysql_url $mysql_version" fi # These packages are required by mysql-cluster, but may not be # pulled in automatically install_package python-paramiko install_package libclass-methodmaker-perl # install the 3 packages for mysql cluster install_package mysql-cluster-community-management-server install_package mysql-cluster-community-data-node install_package mysql-cluster-community-server else exit_distro_not_supported "mysql installation" fi # configure various config files configure_mysql_cluster_backend # start up the cluster start_mysql_cluster_backend } function configure_mysql_cluster_backend { echo_summary "Configuring mysql-cluster backend" # add ndbcluster options to my.cnf my_conf=$(get_my_conf) iniset -sudo $my_conf mysqld ndbcluster "-empty-no-equal-sign" iniset -sudo $my_conf mysqld "default-storage-engine" NDBCLUSTER iniset -sudo $my_conf mysqld init-connect "'SET NAMES utf8'" iniset -sudo $my_conf mysqld max_connections 2048 iniset -sudo $my_conf mysqld ndb-wait-setup 3600 iniset -sudo $my_conf mysqld collation-server utf8_unicode_ci iniset -sudo $my_conf mysqld character-set-server utf8 iniset -sudo $my_conf mysqld ndb-cluster-connection-pool 1 # NOTE: snoyes: using $MYSQL_HOST here results in ndbd startup error. # This needs to be 127.0.0.1 for a single node cluster environment. iniset -sudo $my_conf mysqld ndb-connectstring 127.0.0.1 # load config.ini config_ini=/var/lib/mysql-cluster/config.ini sudo mkdir -p /var/lib/mysql-cluster sudo mkdir -p /usr/local/mysql/data iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" NoOfReplicas 1 iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" DataMemory 2G iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" IndexMemory 2G iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" MaxNoOfTables 4096 iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" MaxNoOfAttributes 20000 iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" MaxNoOfOrderedIndexes 2000 iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" MaxNoOfTriggers 3000 iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" ServerPort 2202 iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" datadir /usr/local/mysql/data iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" TransactionDeadlockDetectionTimeout 120000 iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" MaxNoOfConcurrentOperations 32768 iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" MaxNoOfExecutionThreads 2 iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" MaxBufferedEpochs 100 iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" MaxBufferedEpochBytes 26214400 iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" LockPagesInMainMemory 0 iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" NoOfFragmentLogParts 4 iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" NoOfFragmentLogFiles 16 iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" FragmentLogFileSize 16M iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" MinDiskWriteSpeed 10M iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" MaxDiskWriteSpeed 20M iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndbd default" TimeBetweenLocalCheckpoints 20 iniset -sudo $config_ini "ndb_mgmd default" datadir /var/lib/mysql-cluster iniset -sudo $config_ini ndb_mgmd HostName $MYSQL_HOST iniset -sudo $config_ini ndb_mgmd DataDir /usr/local/mysql/data iniset -sudo $config_ini ndbd HostName $MYSQL_HOST iniset -sudo $config_ini mysqld HostName $MYSQL_HOST } function install_database_python_mysql-cluster { # Install Python client module pip_install_gr $MYSQL_DRIVER if [[ "$MYSQL_DRIVER" == "MySQL-python" ]]; then ADDITIONAL_VENV_PACKAGES+=",MySQL-python" elif [[ "$MYSQL_DRIVER" == "PyMySQL" ]]; then ADDITIONAL_VENV_PACKAGES+=",PyMySQL" fi } function database_connection_url_mysql-cluster { local db=$1 echo "$BASE_SQL_CONN/$db?charset=utf8" } function stop_mysql_cluster_backend { if is_cluster_running; then echo_summary "Stopping mysql-cluster backend" sudo ndb_mgm -e shutdown for i in {1..15}; do if ! is_cluster_running; then break fi sleep 1 done if [ $i -eq 15 ]; then die $LINENO "Failed to stop mysql-cluster" fi fi } function start_mysql_cluster_backend { if is_cluster_running; then stop_mysql_cluster_backend fi echo_summary "Starting mysql-cluster backend" sudo ndb_mgmd -f /var/lib/mysql-cluster/config.ini --reload sleep 5 sudo ndbd sleep 5 ndb_mgm -e show } function is_cluster_running { [ -n "`pgrep ndb_mgm`" ] } function get_my_conf { # Get path to mysql my.cnf config file local my_conf if is_ubuntu; then my_conf=/etc/mysql/my.cnf elif is_suse || is_oraclelinux; then my_conf=/etc/my.cnf else exit_distro_not_supported "mysql configuration" fi echo "$my_conf" } # Restore xtrace $_XTRACE_DB_MYSQL # Local variables: # mode: shell-script # End:

commit_message:
Retry attachment delete API call for 504 Gateway Timeout

When cinder-api runs behind a load balancer(eg haproxy), the load
balancer can return 504 Gateway Timeout when cinder-api does not
respond within timeout. This change ensures nova retries deleting
a volume attachment in that case.

Also this change makes nova ignore 404 in the API call. This is
required because cinder might continue deleting the attachment even if
the load balancer returns 504. This also helps us in the situation
where the volume attachment was accidentally removed by users.

Conflicts:
    nova/volume/cinder.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict is because change
I4573a7c5f3a7b5716a15fbd15ad9336807843a03 (trivial: Remove log
translations) is not in Ussuri.

Closes-Bug: #1978444
Change-Id: I593011d9f4c43cdae7a3d53b556c6e2a2b939989
(cherry picked from commit 8f4b740ca5292556f8e953a30f2a11ed4fbc2945)

commit_message:
Octavia Jobboard integration

Add parameters for configuring Octavia Jobboard for the amphorav2
provider.

Jobboard for Octavia is enabled by the OctaviaEnableJobbard (default
false), Octavia is configured by puppet and THT creates an additional
database to store persistent objects managed by Octavia (dbname is
octavia_persistence).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/874836

Change-Id: Ia16b840ce63319375eddf860a4024c2ad47fab96
(cherry picked from commit 3f55cbfbcf34822ca35f12240d7ebac6270ed6cf)

commit_message:
Fix test malicious tarball fail

Since I650fcbc8f773fad8116338f6fb0cf7b4f4f17b33 builds from git fails
on plugins with an exception: 'tarfile.ReadError: not a gzip file'
because the test checks only gzip compressed archives but plugins
created as plain tar files. This change fixes the issue using
transparent compression support and also adds some debug info.

Closes-Bug: #1990432
Change-Id: If0f9b4dd058a257d0653332d1b663e150c717304
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Michal Nasiadka <mnasiadka@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix devstack-platform-xenial by using stable upper-constraints in Tempest venv

devstack-platform-xenial job need to use the compatile Tempest
version which is 23.0.0 and so does the compatible upper
constraints.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/774913

Change-Id: I2703a84f6339336587f6932180b01d873ed1ec91

commit_message:
Update opensuse version

Nova has newer qemu requirements which needs opensuse 15.2 to meet. The
infra opensuse 15 images are 15.2 now to accomodate that. Update
opensuse's supported version to match.

Change-Id: I6f3c5234920b185b2b0cd9c358371402f7a7b922
(cherry picked from commit 471f1625bb3ae9b11d9da69404f945a19d8b010a)

commit_message:
[OVN] Add DVR configuration support

This patch allows users to configure OVN DVR via DevStack. A new
OVN_ENABLE_DVR variable was added, defaults to False.

Change-Id: Ic3be22aeaa0eb354fa5d880e2f0f1e1c871a73b1
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

added_lines: # Enable or disable DVR OVN_ENABLE_DVR=$(trueorfalse False OVN_ENABLE_DVR) function use_provider_network { if is_provider_network || [[ $Q_USE_PROVIDERNET_FOR_PUBLIC == "True" ]]; then return 0 fi return 1 } if use_provider_network && [[ "$OVN_ENABLE_DVR" == "True" ]]; then populate_ml2_config /$Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE ovn enable_distributed_floating_ip="True" fi if use_provider_network; then

commit_message:
Revert "Add route to IPv6 private subnets in ML2/OVN"

This reverts commit 949f5ada608961fd05435e01bd9d06757b6c62c5.

Reason for revert: This is breaking basic devstack when using neutron's ovn sample file:

    https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/devstack/ovn-local.conf.sample

    central: + lib/neutron_plugins/services/l3:_neutron_configure_router_v6:422 :   sudo ip -6 addr replace 2001:db8::2/64 dev br-ex
    central: RTNETLINK answers: Permission denied
    central: + lib/neutron_plugins/services/l3:_neutron_configure_router_v6:1 :   exit_trap
    central: + ./stack.sh:exit_trap:503                 :   local r=2

Change-Id: I76e345de3e86bb917a2e77f4a3e3dff029f1eec1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/51/799251/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This logic is specific to using the l3-agent for layer 3 if is_service_enabled q-l3 || is_service_enabled neutron-l3; then
deleted_lines: # This logic is specific to using OVN or the l3-agent for layer 3 if ([[ $Q_AGENT == "ovn" ]] && is_service_enabled q-svc neutron-server) || is_service_enabled q-l3 neutron-l3; then # Any IPv6 private subnet that uses the default IPV6 subnet pool # and that is plugged into the default router (Q_ROUTER_NAME) will # be reachable from the devstack node (ex: ipv6-private-subnet). # Some scenario tests (such as octavia-tempest-plugin) rely heavily # on this feature.

subject: [TEST][DEBUG][1] Check arm64 devstack job healthy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-04-04 08:39:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/3556c1ce1148b372184c663979fe0ffa5b6f5112', 'message': "[Test] Install libtirpc3 for aarch64

This work try to targeting kernal panic in [1]

Before the kernel panic, we found this message:
`/sbin/init: can't load library 'libtirpc.so.3'`

Therefore, install libtirpc3 in this patch.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1888224

Change-Id: I7951906e32ce6f98b46a53eff4ca13bfea53cb6f
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2021-04-04 09:38:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/f6306d0ea5944780a9829a15a8881793cf72655e', 'message': "[Test] Install libtirpc3 for aarch64

This work try to targeting kernal panic in [1]

Before the kernel panic, we found this message:
`/sbin/init: can't load library 'libtirpc.so.3'`

Therefore, install libtirpc3 in this patch.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1888224

added_lines: # Install libtirpc for aarch64 CPU architecture if is_arch "aarch64"; then install_package libtirpc3 fi

subject: Add ARM64 (AArch64) devstack tempest job

commit_message:
[WIP] add aarch64 devstack job

This patch tries to create an AArch64 based job to test
openstack on arm based on my recnet use of devstack on an m1 macbook air.

while i have not run tempest locally yet i have been able to boot an
all in one devstack in 6GB vm using ubuntu 20.04 and manually boot vms
using the upstream cirros image.

this patch tries to replicate that in the upstream ci and run tempest
full using the ubuntu-focal-arm64 nodepool lable.

initally all service i have not tested locally have been disbaled creating
a more or less minimal install comprising nova, neutron, keystone
placement, cinder and glance.

other service can be added in the future once the core set are stable.

Change-Id: I7e61c8e569a8d05942957835c97c05c77c5979f4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/39/828639/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - nodeset: name: devstack-single-node-aarch64 nodes: - name: controller label: ubuntu-focal-arm64 groups: - name: tempest nodes: - controller - job: name: devstack-platform-aarch64 parent: tempest-full-py3 description: tempest full on aarch64 nodeset: devstack-single-node-aarch64 # this is proably too large but start with long time out timeout: 10800 vars: configure_swap_size: 4096 devstack_localrc: # m1.nano seams to not boot with arm but d1 works fine so this is likely a memory issue. # increase to m1.micros to balance ram usage with vm performance DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE: m1.micro ENABLE_VOLUME_MULTIATTACH: False # limit services initally to reduce scope for failure ENABLED_SERVICES=key,n-api,n-cpu,n-cond,n-sch,n-api-meta,placement-api,placement-client,g-api,c-sch,c-api,c-vol,ovn-controller,ovn-northd,ovs-vswitchd,ovsdb-server,q-svc,q-ovn-metadata-agent,rabbit,tempest,mysql # reduce tempest concurrency for now until this job works tempest_concurrency: 2 devstack_local_conf: post-config: $NOVA_CONF: libvirt: # arm uses uefi and the virt machine type which uses pcie not pci # libvirt by default only allocates one addtional pcie device for hot plug. # increase this to 10 so that we can test volume and interface attach/detach # without hitting this limit. note each pcie root port increase qemu memory usage # so we dont set this to the max allowed value. num_pcie_ports: 10

commit_message:
remove egg-link files on unstack

on some distros (ubuntu 20.04 aarch64) pip will refuse to uninstall
packages that are not located under /usr.
This breaks unstacking and restacking as the second install can
refuse to uninstall the exising copy.

to adress this in addtion to removing the pyc files unstack.sh will
now remove the egg-link files so that pip no longer considers the
repos installed in $DEST (/opt/stack) as installed.

Change-Id: I6795cdf23985a2de645f512cecc57a40a4b253f1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/33/828633/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
set default LIBVIRT_CPU_MODEL based on ARCH

This change mainntains the current default for x86_64
updates LIBVIRT_CPU_MODEL to max on aarch64 and
qemu64 for lack of a better default on anything else.

To ensure correct defaults, fallback to qemu is moved to
stackrc and aarch64 host are only set to host-passthrough
if kvm is available.

Change-Id: Ie3175069db75c4b3a7a3cfd9df136017c22618df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/32/828632/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Check for kvm (hardware based virtualization). If unable to initialize # kvm, we drop back to the slower emulation mode (qemu). Note: many systems # come with hardware virtualization disabled in BIOS. if [[ "$LIBVIRT_TYPE" == "kvm" ]]; then sudo modprobe kvm || true if [ ! -e /dev/kvm ]; then echo "WARNING: Switching to QEMU" LIBVIRT_TYPE=qemu if which selinuxenabled >/dev/null 2>&1 && selinuxenabled; then # https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=753589 sudo setsebool virt_use_execmem on fi fi fi if is_arch "aarch64" && [ ${LIBVIRT_TYPE} == "kvm" ]; then LIBVIRT_CPU_MODE=${LIBVIRT_CPU_MODE:-"host-passthrough"} else LIBVIRT_CPU_MODE=${LIBVIRT_CPU_MODE:-custom} fi if [[ -z ${LIBVIRT_CPU_MODEL} && ${LIBVIRT_CPU_MODE} == "custom" ]]; then if [ is_arch "x86" || is_arch "x86_64) ]; then LIBVIRT_CPU_MODEL=Nehalem elif [ is_arch "aarch64" ]; then LIBVIRT_CPU_MODEL=max else LIBVIRT_CPU_MODEL=qemu64 fi fi

commit_message:
Use master upper-constraints when install_temepst's creating venv

Below patch has changed the configure_tempest() to use
master branch's upper-constraints to avoid conflict in requirement
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/473525/

install_tempest() still use the branch based upper_contraint. Which
has no issue as the same venv will be build/install with master's
upper_constraint in configure_tempest() method.

We can use master's upper_constraint in install_tempest() also
so that from starting of venv creation we use master constraint
and avoid duplicate uninstall/install the dependency.

Change-Id: I5e7b58eb0c07c509e340afbfcd2b402c651c3731
Related-bug: #1706009
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/37/639637/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The requirements might be on a different branch, while tempest needs master requirements. (cd $REQUIREMENTS_DIR && git show master:upper-constraints.txt) > u-c-m.txt $TEMPEST_DIR/.tox/tempest/bin/pip install -c u-c-m.txt -r requirements.txt # The requirements might be on a different branch, while tempest & tempest plugins needs master requirements. (cd $REQUIREMENTS_DIR && git show master:upper-constraints.txt) > u-c-m.txt tox -evenv-tempest -- pip install -c u-c-m.txt $TEMPEST_PLUGINS

commit_message:
Re-apply "Fix rdo-release install"

The fix in Change-Id Icb07dcb4c9a3950a3c31a3a8dcb8d0b4c713fdb1 was
reverted in Change-Id If7ddbd6655086657db03074a27a2d47053fd88e0. In
doing so, deployments from stable branches reverted to install master
RDO repositories.

Change-Id: I8c0c0e34c3d5fdc72d4d8fa23c670314b3ac20ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/84/776084/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ "$TARGET_BRANCH" == "master" ]]; then local deps="$(get_extra_file https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos8/delorean-deps.repo)" sudo cp $deps /etc/yum.repos.d/ else # Get latest rdo-release-$rdo_release RPM package version local rdo_release=$(echo $TARGET_BRANCH | sed "s|stable/||g") yum_install https://rdoproject.org/repos/openstack-$rdo_release/rdo-release-$rdo_release.rpm fi
deleted_lines: # NOTE(ianw) 2020-04-30 : when we have future branches, we # probably want to install the relevant branch RDO release as # well. But for now it's all master. local deps="$(get_extra_file https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos8/delorean-deps.repo)" sudo cp $deps /etc/yum.repos.d/

subject: Install master delorean-deps
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-02-16 10:48:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/ca23d8ac8662b84b8986876c3956a76e32168c43', 'message': 'Install master delorean-deps

Package rdo-release.rpm is intended to configure CloudSIG repositories,

commit_message:
Install master delorean-deps

Package rdo-release.rpm is intended to configure CloudSIG repositories,
and those are only for released versions. It defaults to the latest
released OpenStack series. As so, required greatest and latest
dependencies in master OpenStack may not be met. For CentOS-based master
devstack deployments the latest and greatest dependency packages need to
be available, and that is provided by master delorean-deps [1].

[1] https://dlrn.readthedocs.io/en/latest/repositories.html#dlrn-repository-delorean-deps

Change-Id: Id9f96f6dd55e964c32a7da8633c5acea2e1133b8

commit_message:
Added Zuul job devstack-reboot-tempest

This job will reboot the host before running Tempest,
which will catch issues with e.g. ephemeral loop devices.

Change-Id: I3b4c226409c92854b486261deaece7f94566e108

commit_message:
Add control plane testing during update.

We use a light shell daemon to start "workload_launch.sh sanityfast"
in a loop.

The daemon, collect the log of each individual run in a "ccp-<PID>"
directory and the result in check-control-plane-<PID>.log.  The pid
can be found in check-control-plane.pid.

In tripleo-upgrade we add the usual check integration at the relevant
part of the update. The new boolean option
"--update-controlplane-check" is added to the infrared interface.

By default this test is not activated. control_plane_check variable
control that behavior outside of infrared.

Change-Id: Ieff860667cf67a1c1f67221b05575e952a0636fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/37/873237/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- - name: Stop control plane testing. shell: | {{ working_dir }}/control_plane_test_stop.sh when: control_plane_check|bool

commit_message:
Fix floating ip selection

The floating ip selection didn't count with possibility of
stopped workloads on the environment. We now list running hosts
and join them against available virtual ips.

Co-authored-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7d46100eccf43159f47e620d14fae3b66701a4d9
(cherry picked from commit cd5a4287461b91d57b7058ad63928436b0f1efcb)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/75/879175/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo export VM_IP=$(openstack floating ip list -c 'Floating IP Address' -f json | grep Address | cut -d '"' -f4 | grep "`openstack server list --status ACTIVE -c Networks -f json | grep Networks | cut -d'=' -f2 | sed -e 's/, /\n/g' -e 's/\"//'`" | head -n1) > {{ working_dir }}/vm_ip.sh
deleted_lines: echo export VM_IP=$(openstack floating ip list -f json | jq -r -c '.[] | select(.Port) | .["Floating IP Address"]' | head -1) > {{ working_dir }}/vm_ip.sh

commit_message:
Use SDK instead of neutronclient

The python-neutronclient has been deprecated for the CLI since Ocata and
the python bindings "neutronclient" has been deprecated for removal as
of the 2023.1 (Antelope) release[1] in favor of using openstacksdk.
This patch migrates Designate from using the neutronclient to using the
openstacksdk for communicating with neutron.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/python-neutronclient/2023.1.html

Co-Authored-By: Michael Johnson <johnsomor@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I0198f38afe3d5c32ea06d9e674ab0ff849f360e6
Related-Bug: #1999774

commit_message:
Pin openvswitch package on RHEL to 2.17

OVS 3.1 was released by CentOS NFV SIG which is built against newer
rdma-core libraries leading to uninstallable openvswitch3.1 on
Rocky Linux due to missing libmlx5.so.1(MLX5_1.24).

While CentOS doesn't need this specific rollback, it will be easier to
fix gates this way.

Closes-Bug: #2013189
Change-Id: I388c115d368c0c0638d1dd4f9f11f4448a13a6b1
(cherry picked from commit 181036c13bd2e9b09dabba6faea827c99a8adf6c)

commit_message:
Add virtualization (virt) repo to StarlingX

This new repository will be the new place to store code related to
StarlingX virtualization packages and tools.
It will be the result of splitting the virt directory from
starlingx/integ in order to separate the virtualization stack from it.

Signed-off-by: Thales Elero Cervi <thaleselero.cervi@windriver.com>
Change-Id: I3195abfc9ef5b156b5a8591b1d6b595c76081658
