the order defined in the config file. They will use a ^ or ~
underline rather than -.

Users define subsections by adding a number to the end
of the section entry, either 2 or 3. It will be a subsection
of the parent section above it. This syntax is simpler than others
considered, like nesting lists inside a top-level section. It also
makes it easy for us to support deeper levels of nesting if we'd like.

Like normal sections, in users' notes files, they will use the
ID they define for each subsection.

Change-Id: Ib7b4781de81e19d11a7acb863204067c0946827b

commit_message:
Add support for subsections

Subsections will appear underneath their top-level section, in
the order defined in the config file. They will use a ^ or ~
underline rather than -.

Users define subsections by adding a number to the end
of the section entry, either 2 or 3. It will be a subsection
of the parent section above it. This syntax is simpler than others
considered, like nesting lists inside a top-level section. It also
makes it easy for us to support deeper levels of nesting if we'd like.

Like normal sections, in users' notes files, they will use the
ID they define for each subsection.

Change-Id: Ib7b4781de81e19d11a7acb863204067c0946827b
Story: 2010375

added_lines: 'features_subsection': [ 'This is a subsection feature.', ], [ 'features', 'New Features', [['features_subsection', 'Subsection']], ], features_subsection_pos = result.index('Subsection') expected = [ prelude_pos, features_pos, features_subsection_pos, api_pos ] actual = sorted( [prelude_pos, features_pos, features_subsection_pos, api_pos] ) def test_header_underlines(self): result = formatter.format_report( loader=self.ldr, config=self.c, versions_to_include=self.versions, title=None, ).splitlines() def assert_header(header: str, char: str) -> None: pos = next( i for i, line in enumerate(result) if line.strip() == header ) expected = char * len(header) self.assertEqual(result[pos + 1].strip(), expected) assert_header("New Features", "-") assert_header("Subsection", "^")
deleted_lines: ['features', 'New Features'], expected = [prelude_pos, api_pos, features_pos] actual = list(sorted([prelude_pos, features_pos, api_pos]))

commit_message:
alpine support

This change adds support for alpine images using
dropbear for ssh. dropbear is currently used because
the openssh-server element was not accpeting logings
via public key.

Change-Id: I7db02c1bdc8c6e466eee30a72ee8c70cf8ee0bf5

added_lines: #!/bin/bash if [ ${DIB_DEBUG_TRACE:-1} -gt 0 ]; then set -x fi set -eu set -o pipefail [ -n "$TARGET_ROOT" ] #TMP_HOOKS_PATH=/home/ubuntu/repos/diskimage-builder/diskimage_builder/elements/cache-url/ export DIB_RELEASE=${DIB_RELEASE:-3.12} export DIB_Z_RELEASE=${DIB_Z_RELEASE:-0} export DIB_DISTRIBUTION_MIRROR=${DIB_DISTRIBUTION_MIRROR:-https://uk.alpinelinux.org/alpine} if [[ "amd64 x86_64" =~ "$ARCH" ]]; then ARCH="x86_64" fi BASE_IMAGE_FILENAME=${BASE_IMAGE_FILENAME:-alpine-minirootfs-${DIB_RELEASE}.${DIB_Z_RELEASE}-${ARCH}.tar.gz} DIB_CLOUD_IMAGES=${DIB_CLOUD_IMAGES:-${DIB_DISTRIBUTION_MIRROR}/v${DIB_RELEASE}/releases/${ARCH}/${BASE_IMAGE_FILENAME}} CACHED_IMAGE=$DIB_IMAGE_CACHE/$BASE_IMAGE_FILENAME SHA256_URL=${DIB_CLOUD_IMAGES}.sha256 $TMP_HOOKS_PATH/bin/cache-url $DIB_CLOUD_IMAGES $CACHED_IMAGE $TMP_HOOKS_PATH/bin/cache-url $SHA256_URL $CACHED_IMAGE.sha256 pushd $DIB_IMAGE_CACHE # Calculate sha256sum of downloaded image and check against content from sha256 file SHA256SUM=$(sha256sum ${BASE_IMAGE_FILENAME} | cut -d " " -f1) grep -q $SHA256SUM ${BASE_IMAGE_FILENAME}.sha256 popd # Extract the base image (use --numeric-owner to avoid UID/GID mismatch between # image tarball and host OS sudo tar -C $TARGET_ROOT --numeric-owner -xzf $CACHED_IMAGE sudo mount -t proc none $TARGET_ROOT/proc sudo mount -t sysfs none $TARGET_ROOT/sys trap "sudo umount $TARGET_ROOT/proc; sudo umount $TARGET_ROOT/sys" EXIT sudo cp /etc/resolv.conf $TARGET_ROOT/etc/ apk_install="sudo chroot $TARGET_ROOT /sbin/apk" # dib-lint: safe_sudo # install minimal packages to run dib-run-parts # coreutils is required to support --tempdir for mktemp # finduties is required for -xtype # openrc is required for rc-update $apk_install add bash sudo findutils coreutils python3 openrc

commit_message:
Remove noisy log statement for deleted release notes

I believe this `print()` statement was not intentional, as it's the only `print` to `sys.stderr` in the entire project. We already are logging to debug level, so we don't need to also print.

This issue causes ~20 log lines for Qiskit Terra any time we run Reno.

Change-Id: I664156017ea24e819c6a7cffe6711376306b59fe

commit_message:
Test for unsafe files in tarfile.extractall

In addition to that, mark bifrost unbuildable since it's
failing on EPEL 9 enablement.

Closes-Bug: #1990432

added_lines: def _test_for_malicious_tarball(path, filename): """Raise exception if extracting would escape extract path""" tar_file = tarfile.open(filename, 'r|gz') for n in tar_file.getnames(): if not os.path.abspath(os.path.join(path, n)).startswith(path): tar_file.close() self.logger.exception('Unsafe filenames in image %s', filename) image.status = Status.ERROR tar_file.close() archive_tar.extractall( members=_test_for_malicious_tarball(items_path, archive), path=items_path)

subject: Fix encryption symlink issues
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-12-05 06:13:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-brick/commit/de3a0e8454453b25e97756438e16ae34f29226c6', 'message': 'Fix encryption symlink issues

This patch fixes 2 issues related to the symlinks, or lack of, that
connectors' connect_volume methods return.

Some connectors always return the block device instead of a symlink for
encrypted volumes, and other connectors return a symlink that is owned
by the system's udev rules.  Both cases are problematic

Returning the real device can prevent the encryptor connect_volume to
complete successfully, and in other cases (such as nvmeof) it completes,
but on the connector's disconnect volume it will leave the device behind
(i.e., /dev/nvme0n1) preventing new connections that would use that same
device name.

Returning a symlink owned by the system's udev rules means that they can
be reclaimed by those rules at any time.  This can happen with
cryptsetup, because when it creates a new mapping it triggers udev rules
for the device that can reclaim the symlink after os-brick has replaced
it.

This patch creates a couple of decorators to facilitate this for all
connectors. These decorators transform the paths so that the callers
gets the expected symlink, but the connector doesn't need to worry about
it and will always see the value it returns regardless of what symlink
the caller gets.

From this moment onwards we use our own custom symlink that starts with
"/dev/disk/by-id/os-brick".

The patch fixes bugs in other connectors (such as the RBD local
connection), but since there are no open bugs they have not been
reported.

Closes-Bug: #1964379
Closes-Bug: #1967790
Change-Id: Ie373ab050dcc0a35c749d9a53b6cf5ca060bcb58

commit_message:
Fix encryption symlink issues

This patch fixes 2 issues related to the symlinks, or lack of, that
connectors' connect_volume methods return.

Some connectors always return the block device instead of a symlink for
encrypted volumes, and other connectors return a symlink that is owned
by the system's udev rules.  Both cases are problematic

Returning the real device can prevent the encryptor connect_volume to
complete successfully, and in other cases (such as nvmeof) it completes,
but on the connector's disconnect volume it will leave the device behind
(i.e., /dev/nvme0n1) preventing new connections that would use that same
device name.

Returning a symlink owned by the system's udev rules means that they can
be reclaimed by those rules at any time.  This can happen with
cryptsetup, because when it creates a new mapping it triggers udev rules
for the device that can reclaim the symlink after os-brick has replaced
it.

This patch creates a couple of decorators to facilitate this for all
connectors. These decorators transform the paths so that the callers
gets the expected symlink, but the connector doesn't need to worry about
it and will always see the value it returns regardless of what symlink
the caller gets.

From this moment onwards we use our own custom symlink that starts with
"/dev/disk/by-id/os-brick".

The patch fixes bugs in other connectors (such as the RBD local
connection), but since there are no open bugs they have not been
reported.

This commit also includes a squash to add a fix and releasenote from
Ib001e2b4d1347754c2b46730bc10d86e8cdab7ad to reduce backporting
workload.

Closes-Bug: #1964379
Closes-Bug: #1967790
Closes-Bug: #1981455
Change-Id: Ie373ab050dcc0a35c749d9a53b6cf5ca060bcb58
(cherry picked from commit 1583a5038d34fd560b554e0eee5c1c5a7612722f)
(cherry picked from commit 0bd5dc99152261d1d59ecb788faf4aea3e299edd)
(cherry picked from commit b31b109f0f95c0102300bbda15b011f3623a2873)
Conflicts: os_brick/utils.py
	os_brick/initiator/connectors/iscsi.py
	os_brick/initiator/connectors/nvmeof.py
(cherry picked from commit cf69f9247061bd0a945a6fb6bf688acff617eb2c)

commit_message:
Ensure systemd-udev is installed for gluster

We're relying on udev to exists for glusterfs since we're
applying overrides for it as well as attempting to restart.

While systemd-udev seems not being pre-installed in all CentOS
containers anymore, so we should ensure it's installed
before trying to adjust it's unit file.

Change-Id: I7d952b371bdfa41c17eaa4248b8249ca772258bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins refs/changes/03/878803/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove tripleo::profile::base::database::mysql::client

The functionality is replaced by the tripleo_mysql_client standalone
ansible role from
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/840321

Depends-On: Ib833d570b7064fdb4e5d6bc5fa899c0b6d602a7a
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2f99eb8f592adca624685fdcab044fb1f58b687d

commit_message:
Clean up working dir from tox role-addition

Running tox -e role-addition left the working directory. This commit
adds configuration for commands_post that will clean up behind the test.

Change-Id: I7293294afe3ed814ed453a3c13d3fbf51db0f84c
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use tripleo_mysql_client standalone ansible role

Updates tripleo-heat-templates to use the new
tripleo_mysql_client role that was added in
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/840321.

Change-Id: Ib833d570b7064fdb4e5d6bc5fa899c0b6d602a7a
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/22/840322/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ansible_group_vars: tripleo_ansible_mysql_client_bind_address: tripleo_ansible_mysql_client_enable_ssl: {get_param: EnableInternalTLS} tripleo_ansible_mysql_client_ssl_ca: {get_param: InternalTLSCAFile} deploy_steps_tasks: - include_role: name: tripleo_mysql_client tasks_from: config.yaml when: (step|int) == 1

commit_message:
Default molecule verifier to ansible for podman driver

ansible is the default verifier for molecule, however this patch sets it
explicitly for the podman driver for readability.

The login_defs, tripleo_kernel, and tripleo_sshd roles still had their
verifiers set to testinfra in their individual molecule.yml configs.
That resulted in the verify.yml for these roles being ignored and never
executed. That configuration is removed in favor of just inheriting the
config from the base molecule config for the podman driver.

This also updates the _skeleton_role_ to remove the verifier configured
as testinfra.

Note that many other roles still have their verifier set to testinfra,
however they have no ansible tests in a verify.yml or any pytests
defined. These can be cleaned up in a different patch.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I05f79b5675ceb5d56622001ef94f0a47ffd0bc87
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/63/857763/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: verifier: name: ansible

ansible-role-chrony task refactorings.

commit_message:
Use tripleo_logrotate_crond standalone ansible role

Update tripleo-heat-templates to use the new tripleo_logrotate_crond
role that was added in
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/841997.

Change-Id: I0d36a6d653e73febea532da599e16cae21dd82b9
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/06/842006/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ansible_group_vars: tripleo_logrotate_crond_purge_after_days: {get_param: LogrotatePurgeAfterDays} tripleo_logrotate_crond_config_volume: /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/crond tripleo_logrotate_crond_image: {get_attr: [RoleParametersValue, value, ContainerCrondConfigImage]} host_prep_tasks: - name: tripleo_logrotate_crond install tasks include_role: name: tripleo_logrotate_crond tasks_from: logrotate_crond_install.yaml deploy_steps_tasks: - name: tripleo_logrotate_crond configure tasks include_role: name: tripleo_logrotate_crond tasks_from: logrotate_crond_configure.yaml - name: logrotate-crond container when: step|int == 4 include_role: name: tripleo_logrotate_crond tasks_from: logrotate_crond.yaml update_tasks: - name: logrotate-crond update include_role: name: tripleo_logrotate_crond tasks_from: logrotate_crond_update.yaml upgrade_tasks: - name: logrotate-crond upgrade when: step|int == 1 include_role: name: tripleo_logrotate_crond tasks_from: logrotate_crond_upgrade.yaml
deleted_lines: host_prep_tasks: - name: allow logrotate to read inside containers seboolean: name: logrotate_read_inside_containers persistent: true state: true when: - ansible_facts.selinux is defined - ansible_facts.selinux.status == "enabled" deploy_steps_tasks: - name: configure tmpwatch on the host block: - name: Push script copy: dest: /usr/local/sbin/containers-tmpwatch owner: root group: root mode: 0755 content: | #!/bin/sh tmpwatch --nodirs \ -X "/var/log/containers/*/*log" \ -X "/var/log/containers/*/*/*log" \ -X "/var/log/containers/*/*err" \ {{ LogrotatePurgeAfterDays|int +1 }}d \ /var/log/containers/ 2>&1 | logger -t container-tmpwatch vars: LogrotatePurgeAfterDays: {get_param: LogrotatePurgeAfterDays} - name: Insert cronjob in root crontab cron: name: "Remove old logs" special_time: "daily" user: "root" job: "/usr/local/sbin/containers-tmpwatch" update_tasks: &tmpwatch_script_clean - name: Ensure old cron.daily is absent file: path: /etc/cron.daily/containers-tmpwatch state: absent upgrade_tasks: *tmpwatch_script_clean kolla_config: /var/lib/kolla/config_files/logrotate-crond.json: command: /usr/sbin/crond -s -n config_files: - source: "/var/lib/kolla/config_files/src/*" dest: "/" merge: true preserve_properties: true docker_config: step_4: logrotate_crond: image: {get_attr: [RoleParametersValue, value, ContainerCrondImage]} net: none pid: host privileged: true user: root restart: always healthcheck: test: '/usr/share/openstack-tripleo-common/healthcheck/cron' volumes: list_concat: - {get_attr: [ContainersCommon, volumes]} - - /var/lib/kolla/config_files/logrotate-crond.json:/var/lib/kolla/config_files/config.json:ro - /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/crond:/var/lib/kolla/config_files/src:ro - /var/log/containers:/var/log/containers:z environment: KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY: COPY_ALWAYS

commit_message:
Use standalone playbooks from tripleo-ansible

With the addition of standalone playbooks for management with pure
ansible-playbook in tripelo-ansible, tripleo-heat-templates can be
also updated to make use of the common functionality.

Depends-On: I96412f44193613d32a8752e8ecfec9324b4fd0fb
Change-Id: I880e0979e06c6c39384d3bb178ab30bdb92358b2
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/10/840510/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - import_playbook: /usr/share/ansible/tripleo-playbooks/deploy-tripleo-selinux.yaml vars: deploy_target_host: DEPLOY_TARGET_HOST tripleo_selinux_mode: SELINUX_MODE tripleo_hosts_entries_undercloud_hosts_entries: "{{ undercloud_hosts_entries }}" tripleo_hosts_entries_extra_hosts_entries: "{{ extra_hosts_entries }}" tripleo_hosts_entries_vip_hosts_entries: "{{ vip_hosts_entries }}"
deleted_lines: deploy_steps_selinux_playbook: {{ self.deploy_steps_str_replace_params() }} template: | - hosts: DEPLOY_TARGET_HOST strategy: tripleo_linear name: Manage SELinux gather_facts: "{% raw %}{{ gather_facts | default(false) }}{% endraw %}" any_errors_fatal: true tasks: - name: Set selinux state become: true selinux: policy: targeted state: SELINUX_MODE - hosts: all strategy: tripleo_linear name: Generate /etc/hosts gather_facts: "{% raw %}{{ gather_facts | default(false) }}{% endraw %}" any_errors_fatal: true tasks: {% raw %} - name: Configure Hosts Entries include_role: name: tripleo_hosts_entries vars: tripleo_hosts_entries_undercloud_hosts_entries: "{{ undercloud_hosts_entries }}" tripleo_hosts_entries_extra_hosts_entries: "{{ extra_hosts_entries }}" tripleo_hosts_entries_vip_hosts_entries: "{{ vip_hosts_entries }}" {% endraw %} - import_playbook: deploy_steps_selinux_playbook.yaml

commit_message:
Move some tripleo_podman tasks to ansible role

Moves some of the tasks to the already existing tripleo_podman
standalone ansible role.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Depends-On: I7e735e09caa0f22ed204ece92d3db1395f03c021
Depends-On: I31bb5c2902f5061d6fda74c17cd3df4de4f06c82
Change-Id: Ia4b17c8a30805be15ea1b6736f7181b8b9e066e7

added_lines: ansible_group_vars: tripleo_podman_systemd_drop_in_dependencies: {get_param: SystemdDropInDependencies} - name: Run podman configure tasks_from: tripleo_podman_configure.yml
deleted_lines: - name: Run podman login tasks_from: tripleo_podman_login.yml - if: - {get_param: SystemdDropInDependencies} - - name: Configure tripleo_container_manage to generate systemd drop-in dependencies copy: dest: /etc/sysconfig/podman_drop_in content: | This file makes tripleo_container_manage generate additional systemd dependencies for containers that have special start/stop ordering constraints. It ensures that those constraints are enforced on reboot/shutdown. - - name: Configure tripleo_container_manage to not generate drop-in dependencies file: path: /etc/sysconfig/podman_drop_in state: absent

commit_message:
Revert "Refactor Zaqar to satisfy openstack uwsgi goal"

This reverts commit 5a7636786ec4cc8bdf490c11b94b52f377edebb3.

Reason for revert: We do not handle href links properly and this breaks other services depending on Zaqar.

Change-Id: I5fb0f2f25c280dd69cfb99d9f9b320df552462dc

commit_message:
Support qemu block rbd in nova-compute

This is necessary if using nova-compute with RBD backend (directly,
not via Cinder) and wishing to make an instance image to Glance
while (1) following the recommended Ceph permissions which do not
give Nova write permissions to the images' pool or (2) not using
RBD with Glance or (3) not revealing what Glance actually uses
as the backend (hiding locations).

Closes-Bug: #2013075

Change-Id: I88e1e0ca01b2b2effad9515b905cc761fbb5d2d4
(cherry picked from commit 9e92e4c8e494ec345ccce1eff739f18bf9035c9b)

mypy 1.0 no longer needs one "type: ignore" comment
that we have currently, which must be fixed to resolve

subject: [OVN] OVN agent should register "Chassis_Private" by default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-24 14:34:52.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/ovn/agent/ovn_neutron_agent.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2ccf1e1e90c0643daea19ae3f6c42e59aaac9423', 'message': '[OVN] OVN agent should register "Chassis_Private" by default

The event "SbGlobalUpdateEvent", loaded by default in the Neutron OVN
Agent, reads from OVN SB "SB_Global" table and writes in the
"Chassis_Private" table. The last one is missing in the default tables
that are registered during the SB IDL initialization.

Closes-Bug: #2012385
Change-Id: I51d64375e69f27b265fbaba4d05a03a37c65929e
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] OVN agent should register "Chassis_Private" by default

The event "SbGlobalUpdateEvent", loaded by default in the Neutron OVN
Agent, reads from OVN SB "SB_Global" table and writes in the
"Chassis_Private" table. The last one is missing in the default tables
that are registered during the SB IDL initialization.

Closes-Bug: #2012385
Change-Id: I51d64375e69f27b265fbaba4d05a03a37c65929e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/35/878535/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tables = ['SB_Global', 'Chassis_Private']

commit_message:
Don't check context.system_scope to check project scope

During first attempt of the Secure RBAC implementation [1] to
function model_query_scope_is_project() there was added check
which was checking if context.system_scope is "all" in case when
scope enforcement was enabled. It was like that because that meant
that it is SYSTEM_* persona context (e.g. SYSTEM_ADMIN).
This is not needed now as later it was agreed to have only one ADMIN
user which will still behave like old, "legacy" ADMIN user.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/781075

Conflicts:
    neutron_lib/db/utils.py
    neutron_lib/tests/unit/db/test_utils.py

Closes-bug: #1996150
Change-Id: If3a97c4d3a0f4cb6b4d06434f74cbe9d933a07a4
(cherry picked from commit 91759b17ea5d4d6563596612208e6014dee2ed88)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/96/874396/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If model doesn't have project_id, there is no need to scope query to # Unless context has 'admin' rights the # query will be scoped to a single project_id return not context.is_admin
deleted_lines: from oslo_config import cfg # If model don't have project_id, there is no need to scope query to # TODO(slaweq): Remove that old is_admin check and always check scopes # when old, deprecated rules will be removed and only rules with new # personas will be supported if cfg.CONF.oslo_policy.enforce_new_defaults: # Unless a context is a system_scope token, query should be scoped to a # single project_id return context.system_scope != 'all' else: # Unless context has 'admin' rights the # query will be scoped to a single project_id return not context.is_admin

commit_message:
Don't check context.system_scope to check project scope

During first attempt of the Secure RBAC implementation [1] to
function model_query_scope_is_project() there was added check
which was checking if context.system_scope is "all" in case when
scope enforcement was enabled. It was like that because that meant
that it is SYSTEM_* persona context (e.g. SYSTEM_ADMIN).
This is not needed now as later it was agreed to have only one ADMIN
user which will still behave like old, "legacy" ADMIN user.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/781075

Conflicts:
    neutron_lib/db/utils.py
    neutron_lib/tests/unit/db/test_utils.py

Closes-bug: #1996150
Change-Id: If3a97c4d3a0f4cb6b4d06434f74cbe9d933a07a4
(cherry picked from commit 91759b17ea5d4d6563596612208e6014dee2ed88)

commit_message:
Remove method which created ingress metadata rule in SG

For stateless SG we can't rely on conntrack to allow ingress traffic
from the metadata server and because of that we had extra SG rule added
in the SG in tests were stateless SG was used.
Now, as related bug is fixed it's not needed anymore as Neutron will
automatically add rule for that on the backend's side.

Related-Bug: #2009053

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/876659
Change-Id: I363a5d2110422e6a402a10aadd4d9583bc0cb308

commit_message:
Add functional regression tests for bug 1857306

This adds three regression tests for when option
osapi_compute_unique_server_name_scope is set.
In the first two cases conductor is not handling
the InstanceExists exception raised from the cell
DB API when trying to create an instance so the
instance is stuck in with the BUILD status. In the
third test, osapi_compute_unique_server_name_scope=global
is not honered across multiple cells because the
validation of that option happens in the per-cell
DB API code rather than in the control plane which
can iterate all cells.

Co-Author: Rajesh Tailor <ratailor@redhat.com>

Change-Id: If5701fe603fd73f9bb8ce3fa1a5a0ff9bc8ba35c
Related-Bug: #1857306
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/56/700456/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from nova import test from nova.tests import fixtures as nova_fixtures from nova.tests.functional import fixtures as func_fixtures from nova.tests.functional import integrated_helpers from nova.tests.unit.image import fake as fake_image class UniqueServerNameTestCase(test.TestCase, integrated_helpers.InstanceHelperMixin): """Regression test for bug 1857306 introduced in Ocata where instance creation was moved from the API to conductor. The DB API checks the osapi_compute_unique_server_name_scope option during instance create and if set and there are duplicate instances an InstanceExists exception is raised which previously would be returned to the API user as a 409 error. The regression is that conductor does not handle InstanceExists and set the instance to ERROR status. """ NUMBER_OF_CELLS = 2 def setUp(self): super(UniqueServerNameTestCase, self).setUp() # Start standard fixtures. self.useFixture(func_fixtures.PlacementFixture()) self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.NeutronFixture(self)) fake_image.stub_out_image_service(self) self.addCleanup(fake_image.FakeImageService_reset) # Start nova services. self.api = self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.OSAPIFixture( api_version='v2.1')).admin_api self.api.microversion = '2.37' # so we can create servers w/o network self.start_service('conductor') self.start_service('scheduler') def test_unique_server_name_cell0(self): """Tests handling InstanceExists in _bury_in_cell0.""" self.flags(osapi_compute_unique_server_name_scope='project') # Try to create a server. Since there are no computes scheduling will # fail and the instance should be buried in cell0. server = self._build_minimal_create_server_request( 'test_unique_server_name_cell0', image_uuid=fake_image.get_valid_image_id(), networks='none') server1 = self.api.post_server({'server': server}) server1 = self._wait_for_state_change(server1, 'ERROR') self.assertIn('No valid host', server1['fault']['message']) # Try creating another server with the same name which will fail to # schedule. server2 = self.api.post_server({'server': server}) self._wait_for_log('nova.exception.InstanceExists') # FIXME(mriedem): This is bug 1857306 where the 2nd server fails to go # to ERROR status because the InstanceExists error is not handled in # _bury_in_cell0. self._wait_for_state_change(server2, 'BUILD') def test_unique_server_name_cell1(self): """Tests handling InstanceExists in schedule_and_build_instances.""" self.flags(osapi_compute_unique_server_name_scope='project') # Start a compute so scheduling will succeed. self.start_service('compute', host='host1') # Create a server which will be created on host1 in cell1. server = self._build_minimal_create_server_request( 'test_unique_server_name_cell1', image_uuid=fake_image.get_valid_image_id(), networks='none') server1 = self.api.post_server({'server': server}) self._wait_for_state_change(server1, 'ACTIVE') # Try creating another server with the same name which will pass # scheduling but fail to be created in the cell1 database because it # does not have a unique name. server2 = self.api.post_server({'server': server}) self._wait_for_log('nova.exception.InstanceExists') # FIXME(mriedem): This is bug 1857306 where the 2nd server fails to go # to ERROR status because the InstanceExists error is not handled in # schedule_and_build_instances. self._wait_for_state_change(server2, 'BUILD') def test_unique_server_name_multiple_cells(self): """Tests handling InstanceExists in schedule_and_build_instances when multiple instances with the same name are created in multiple cells. """ self.flags(osapi_compute_unique_server_name_scope='global') # Start a compute so scheduling will succeed for the first server. self.start_service('compute', host='host1', cell='cell1') # Create a server which will be created on host1 in cell1. server = self._build_minimal_create_server_request( 'test_unique_server_name_cell1', image_uuid=fake_image.get_valid_image_id(), networks='none', az='nova:host1') # force to host1 in cell1 server1 = self.api.post_server({'server': server}) self._wait_for_state_change(server1, 'ACTIVE') # Create another cell against host2 in cell2 with the same name as # the first server. self.start_service('compute', host='host2', cell='cell2') server['availability_zone'] = 'nova:host2' server2 = self.api.post_server({'server': server}) # FIXME(mriedem): This is bug 1857306 where the 2nd server should fail # since there is another server with the same name in another cell but # the control plane is not checking uniqueness on the name across cells # as the osapi_compute_unique_server_name_scope check happens in the # per-cell DB API. self._wait_for_state_change(server2, 'ACTIVE')

commit_message:
Fix ORM caching for with_for_update calls

The SQLAlchemy recommends to use populate_existing() when using
with_for_update() [0], it fixed issues with the caching of the objects.

This patch precisely fixes a bug when locking of a loadbalancer in the
batch member update API call, the load balancer might not have been
locked correctly and race conditions could have occurred (processing
simultaneously 2 requests in the workers for the same load balancer).

[0] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/orm/query.html#sqlalchemy.orm.Query.with_for_update

Story 2010646
Task 47642

Co-Authored-By: Gaudenz Steinlin <gaudenz.steinlin@cloudscale.ch>

Change-Id: Ibd4da09079e83789d6cfe3658fcf1f266f5cf8b4
(cherry picked from commit 2e4ee9c65e0fba660b0316f1f4203810bb8a67c0)

Fixed merge conflict in octavia/db/repositories.py

Change-Id: I41bd226a9536bd5c9451dfa281fd0915aa288512

commit_message:
Update supported python versions

- Python 3.5 support was already removed from Tempest[1] so we can
  remove it.
- Add Python 3.8 and 3.9 because these have been part of tested
  runtimes for a few cycles and are actually used in testing.

[1] b0a8057fbbf08ff072bfb6e836535f090fd6efc7

Change-Id: I39b822ef294f673adfb35e5d45672ad1f9347944

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-12-10 09:43:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/a995efce3acee81749cb6476f6e0603cdd9f7a0b', 'message': "Poc SRBAC project-manager support

Add support for a project scoped manager for below image
sharing APIs as per Yoga Secure RBAC community goal,
1. add_member
2. delete_member
3. modify_member

NOTE: The support of default manager role has not been added in
keystone yet, it's currently in progress.

To test this, create new role 'manager' in keystone and add it to
hierarchy which should be like,
reader --> member --> manager --> admin

commit_message:
PoC SRBAC project-manager support

Add support for a project scoped manager for below image
sharing APIs as per Yoga Secure RBAC community goal,
1. add_member
2. delete_member
3. modify_member

NOTE: The existing tempest plugin tests are failing here because
currently the support of manager role and it's implication is not
there in devstack.

Change-Id: I3265ba6169bf0788a6b523057342db9b4e0e8b7b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/79/821379/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

PROJECT_MANAGER = 'role:manager and project_id:%(project_id)s' # Generic check string for checking if a user is authorized on a particularADMIN_OR_PROJECT_MANAGER = f'role:admin or ({PROJECT_MANAGER})' f'role:admin or (role:manager and {IMAGE_MEMBER_CHECK})'

commit_message:
db: Add initial alembic configuration

No migrations yet: this is simply the output of 'alembic init' with some
minor tweaks.

A note about ordering of requirements is removed from requirements.txt:
it is no longer true with the new dependency resolver introduced in pip
20.3.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7790222ab5eaf6c47dd386fe472275a3037a9898

deleted_lines: import sqlalchemydef clone_table(name, parent, meta, newcols=None, ignorecols=None, swapcols=None, ignorecons=None): """Helper function that clones parent table schema onto new table. :param name: new table name :param parent: parent table to copy schema from :param newcols: names of new columns to be added :param ignorecols: names of columns to be ignored while cloning :param swapcols: alternative column schema :param ignorecons: names of constraints to be ignored :return: sqlalchemy.Table instance """ newcols = newcols or [] ignorecols = ignorecols or [] swapcols = swapcols or {} ignorecons = ignorecons or [] cols = [c.copy() for c in parent.columns if c.name not in ignorecols if c.name not in swapcols] cols.extend(swapcols.values()) cols.extend(newcols) new_table = sqlalchemy.Table(name, meta, *(cols)) def _is_ignorable(cons): # consider constraints on columns only if hasattr(cons, 'columns'): for col in ignorecols: if col in cons.columns: return True return False constraints = [c.copy(target_table=new_table) for c in parent.constraints if c.name not in ignorecons if not _is_ignorable(c)] for c in constraints: new_table.append_constraint(c) new_table.create() return new_table def migrate_data(migrate_engine, table, new_table, skip_columns=None): table_name = table.name list_of_rows = list(table.select().execute()) colnames = [c.name for c in table.columns] for row in list_of_rows: values = dict(zip(colnames, map(lambda colname: getattr(row, colname), colnames))) if skip_columns is not None: for column in skip_columns: del values[column] migrate_engine.execute(new_table.insert(values)) table.drop() new_table.rename(table_name)

commit_message:
Using 5.7.29 tag for mysql image.

mysql:5.7 image always links to the lastest mysql 5.7 image,
this may not be stable for our CI test.

Change-Id: I8845918929aeb3c35270be9148120a1f445e3fa9

commit_message:
FFWD3: Refactor system upgrade

Upgrade should use system_upgrade.yaml that provides Leapp options.
Undercloud should use upgrade run with --system-upgrade and the yaml
file. After this run user has to reboot it.

Introduce tag for Controlplane and Compute upgrades separately so we
can have different stages for them.

Cleanup unneeded code for Overcloud upgrade.

Note that all workaround scripts still use os_upgrade instead of
system_upgrade. The changing of the naming convention for the hooks
can be done in another patch.

Co-authored-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Lukas Bezdicka <social@v3.sk>

Change-Id: I573e01b8ce3060f78af5daa61e25fbc428d19518

commit_message:
Fix instance table behavior after deleting an instance

After deleting a VM from the instances table,
all VMs above it in the table list disappear from the
UI until the page is refreshed.

Partial-Bug: #1859851

Change-Id: Icae04fd0f0c3f3fa5127309b64fc1b15e3bbc677
(cherry picked from commit c90c0b709c170fae299acc5917e7da69fb2ef2a8)

commit_message:
Fix ORM caching for with_for_update calls

The SQLAlchemy recommends to use populate_existing() when using
with_for_update() [0], it fixed issues with the caching of the objects.

This patch precisely fixes a bug when locking of a loadbalancer in the
batch member update API call, the load balancer might not have been
locked correctly and race conditions could have occurred (processing
simultaneously 2 requests in the workers for the same load balancer).

[0] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/orm/query.html#sqlalchemy.orm.Query.with_for_update

Story 2010646
Task 47642

Co-Authored-By: Gaudenz Steinlin <gaudenz.steinlin@cloudscale.ch>

commit_message:
Support --os-key option

keystoneclient Session expects as cert argument, one of the followings:
 * None (no client certificate),
 * a path to client certificate,
 * a tuple with client certificate/key paths.

The change updates manilaclient code to support the last case (ie:
os_cert and os_key are non-empty) with the --os-key option
and OS_KEY environment variable.

Closes-Bug: #1999775
Change-Id: I09313b7c55a5f9d4ec032a37e69a1d79db29d648
(cherry picked from commit 43943fdf670328e2fe606c07949190e9e45063ae)
(cherry picked from commit 8d9ea26f56b82044aa74fab669225df47143068e)
(cherry picked from commit 7acf31c62b5b66899aef6c76800c2088d130da7a)

commit_message:
Remove modules to deploy Contrail components

... because manifests to deploy Contrail components are removed.
This also removes elements to install contrail software because there
is no implementation left dependent on the elements in upstream.

Conflicts:

commit_message:
Fix pre-wallaby branches: force an older tempest env

Since Id02221df0d6180519751c63e890851bd59fdafa0, in order to fix
lp#2004780, the job which all jobs defined here inherit from
uses the 'integrated-full' tox environment, which doesn't exist
on older branches. Those should use the 'full' tox environment
instead.

As this devstack plugin is not branched, as long as there are
jobs which use it on older branches, we should make sure
to not break them.

This broke a few other jobs, so use those fixes as examples:
(see I5f1c4de0e7ec0cc6d7f6ba7d7aa78aabc931d23e )

Related-Bug: #2007986
Change-Id: Iec4f5adc5bebb811e1ef44208a98d7403d1e8c01
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-plugin-nfs refs/changes/12/878912/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Retire now-outdated snapshot spec

Snapshot support is expected to come via the newly designed Service
Steps, which is providing a generic framework for performing actions on
ACTIVE Ironic nodes -- including snapshotting.

Ironic contributors will write a new spec about implementing snapshot
via Service Steps once that work is completed.

Story: 2008033
Task: 40689
Change-Id: I288c77eba746c855c0bc9b9fd89ae557cbfddd7a

Backport fixes

This patch contains the following changes squashed into a single commit,
because each change individually doesn't produce a working build:

- 71bc319 Use unittest.mock instead of mock
- d3f30c4 Fix unittest
- Pin tox to < 4.0.0

commit_message:
Reset member provisioning status to NO_MONITOR when a HM is deleted

At present, when a health monitor (HM) is created for a pool,
the members of that pool are automatically set to ONLINE
provisioning status, unless the HM identifies an ERROR during
health checks.

This patch addresses an issue where, after deleting an HM,
the members should be reset to NO_MONITOR provisioning status,
regardless of whether the HM had previously set them to ONLINE
or ERROR status.

Closes-Bug: #2007985
Change-Id: I02bcba61d0cbc9202a6e50b849f8d781fb825d49
(cherry picked from commit 569c9c011a2cc9e5f041633dde4a47257e4d8565)

commit_message:
Add a Note Under Install and configure Section in documentation

This patch adds a note to use keystone port 5000 while configuring
horizon for all distros like ubuntu/debian/rdo/obs under the install
and configure section. Right now if a user tries to set up an OpenStack
env. manually using documentation [1], [2] leads to some confusion
because keystone documents suggest creating keystone endpoint at
http://controller:5000/v3/ rather than http://controller/v3/ while
horizon document consider keystone doesn't run at 5000 port updated
by [3].

Closes-Bug: #1910476
Closes-Bug: #1926096
Closes-Bug: #1950919
Closes-Bug: #1956437
Closes-Bug: #1892279
Closes-Bug: #1903320
Change-Id: I18d0d2105ea54ba02f8979ab7a15a75a0425b8c7

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/install/keystone-install-ubuntu.html#install-and-configure-components
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/horizon/latest/install/install-ubuntu.html#install-and-configure-components
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/697406

Change-Id: I537a963c9d955b8d7e21f0d05b0197588907419e
(cherry picked from commit 029de21c1190bb9d2e38063b62c689c1dbb8ef37)

commit_message:
Fix rescue of volume-based instances

Rescue of volume-based instances is supported since Nova
microversion 2.87.
However, Horizon does not use this microversion when requesting
rescue of any instances, causing a Nova exception for volume-
based ones.

The patch fixes this by explicitly setting the required
microversion.

Closes-Bug: #1941744
Signed-off-by: Jan Hartkopf <jhartkopf@inovex.de>
Change-Id: Ic0cdfd326475882f839fd218cd7b4bfa62a2a76b
(cherry picked from commit 05dd53a3cf3e1ced265d23d1c02765abd468a483)
(cherry picked from commit 761e466e7a0628ae939dd654152f615732ad4f79)
(cherry picked from commit 1cd150cdc568e81eb2ead8819d5559cf3e23a296)

subject: ovn: allow returning metadata packets for stateless security groups
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-07 03:10:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/5465cdde1b1652f66bf319c0f826a40fa5c28af8', 'message': 'ovn: allow returning metadata packets for stateless security groups

With stateless SGs, we can no longer rely on conntrack to allow
returning traffic from metadata service. Instead, we should explicitly
enable the flow via ACL.

This patch creates OVN ACLs for metadata packets (tcp port = 80, src ip
= 169.254.169.254) when the corresponding SG is stateless. It will also
remove the ACLs when SG is switched back to stateful. It will also
utilize the new external_ids:neutron:revision_number key to monitor for
db inconsistencies between neutron and ovn databases.

commit_message:
ovn: allow returning metadata packets for stateless security groups

With stateless SGs, we can no longer rely on conntrack to allow
returning traffic from metadata service. Instead, we should explicitly
enable the flow via ACL.

This patch creates OVN ACLs for metadata packets (tcp port = 80, src ip
= 169.254.169.254) when the corresponding SG is stateless. It will also
remove the ACLs when SG is switched back to stateful. It will also
utilize the new external_ids:neutron:revision_number key to monitor for
db inconsistencies between neutron and ovn databases.

Closes-Bug: #2009053
Change-Id: Ia1313730789f3deb58218477b65d02126a228810
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/59/876659/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(ihrachys): Remove the migration after the first SLURP release after # Bobcat. @periodics.periodic(spacing=10, run_immediately=True) def create_service_traffic_acls_for_stateless_sgs(self): # Only the worker holding a valid lock within OVSDB will perform the # migration. if not self.has_lock: return admin_context = n_context.get_admin_context() nb_sync = ovn_db_sync.OvnNbSynchronizer( self._ovn_client._plugin, self._nb_idl, self._ovn_client._sb_idl, None, None) nb_sync.create_service_traffic_acls_for_stateless_sgs(admin_context) raise periodics.NeverAgain() # The migration will run just once per neutron-server instance. If the lock # is held by some other neutron-server instance in the cloud, we'll attempt # to perform the migration every 10 seconds until completed.

commit_message:
mypy: Fix implicit optional usage

Current versions of mypy run with no-implicit-optional
by default.  This change gets Nova's mypy test environment
to pass again.

Change-Id: Ie50c8d364ad9c339355cc138b560ec4df14fe307

subject: [dhcp] Add DHCP domain_name option from network properties
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-29 09:06:33.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/25a4e2bab63b278951a4e4d76d550818f5ed24c2', 'message': '[dhcp] Add DHCP domain_name option from network properties

When network dns-domain option is set, add it to DHCP domain_name
option. (Not a bug fix, but extend functionality)
! This patch does not break default behavior when dns_domain
statically set up in CONF-file. But it extend functionality (dynamic
per-network DHCP domain_name option).

EXPLANATION.
At current moment DHCP option domain_name can only be set statically
via CONF-file (dns_domain option in neutron.conf), so all instances in all
projects/networks will receive it without respect dns_domain network
property.
This patch make availability to setup domain_name DHCP option from
network dns_domain property if it exist and no static dns_domain option set via
config file

Change-Id: I4ea7a7e02b82297cddba25cbd524eca7fee9330f
'}]
commit_message:
[dhcp] Add DHCP domain_name option from network properties

When network dns-domain option is set, add it to DHCP domain_name
option. (Not a bug fix, but extend functionality)
! This patch does not break default behavior when dns_domain
statically set up in CONF-file. But it extend functionality (dynamic
per-network DHCP domain_name option).

EXPLANATION.
At current moment DHCP option domain_name can only be set statically
via CONF-file (dns_domain option in neutron.conf), so all instances in all
projects/networks will receive it without respect dns_domain network
property.
This patch make availability to setup domain_name DHCP option from
network dns_domain property if it exist and no static dns_domain option set via
config file

Change-Id: I4ea7a7e02b82297cddba25cbd524eca7fee9330f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/20/878820/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif self.network.dns_domain: cmd.append('--domain=%s' % self.network.dns_domain)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If36a55450610d991f19de8a790fb5eec70d69db7

commit_message:
Add neutron_ovn_availability_zones parameter

With the new ``neutron_ovn_availability_zones`` parameter it is possible
to define network availability zones for OVN. Further details can be found
in the Neutron OVN documentation:
https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/admin/ovn/availability_zones.html#how-to-configure-it

Change-Id: I203e0d400a3218d0b4a41f2a948207032c4febec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/77/875777/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Pin openvswitch package on RHEL-likes to 2.17

OVS 3.1 was released by CentOS NFV SIG which is built against newer
rdma-core libraries leading to uninstallable openvswitch3.1 due to
missing libmlx5.so.1(MLX5_1.24)

Related-Bug: #2013189
Change-Id: I918248169e5b4c12ba968c8157576628830c5eb8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/24/878924/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add skip_os_tempest conditional for dataplane adoption jobs

The var is set by [1] which depends-on this patch. This will allow
us to skip tempest in dataplane adoption jobs. This also removes
the redundant conditional for EOL releases p/q/s.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/rdo-jobs/+/47955

Change-Id: I5a8e46e94b51a6c81214673b41c1db1ad16971c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/19/878519/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if job.skip_os_tempest is defined and job.skip_os_tempest | default(false) | bool -%} false {%- elif release not in ['pike', 'queens', 'stein'] -%}

commit_message:
multi-rhel images prepare default

New arguments:
 --enable-multi-rhel : flag to create multi-rhel prepare
 --excludes: list of containers to include/exclude
 --minor-override: tags to override on the minor release
 --major-override: tags to override on the mayor release
 --role: list of the roles
 --role-file: role_data.yaml patch

Example:

[stack@standalone ~]$ openstack tripleo container image prepare default \
 --enable-multi-rhel --excludes nova-compute \
 --excludes nova-libvirt   --excludes ovn-controller \
 --major-override "{'tag':'other_tag'}" \
 --minor-override "{'tag':'my_tag'}"  --role ComputeEL8

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/57/869857/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parser.add_argument( '--enable-multi-rhel', dest='multi_rhel', action='store_true', default=False, help=_('Use this flag to enable multi-rhel') ) parser.add_argument( '--exclude-include', dest='services', action='append', default=[], help=_('List of services to include/exclude') ) parser.add_argument( '--tag', dest='tag', action='store', default='', help=_('The tag for the different version') ) parser.add_argument( '--roles', dest='roles', action='append', default=['ComputeEL8'], help=_('List of roles') ) if parsed_args.multi_rhel: cip_exc = copy.deepcopy(cip) cip_inc = copy.deepcopy(cip) if len(parsed_args.services) > 0: cip_exc[0]['excludes'] = copy.deepcopy(parsed_args.services) cip_inc[0]['includes'] = copy.deepcopy(parsed_args.services) if parsed_args.tag != '': cip_inc[0]['set']['tag'] = parsed_args.tag base_role = [cip_exc[0], cip_inc[0]] for role in parsed_args.roles: params[('{}ContainerImagePrepare').format(role)] = base_role

commit_message:
Add support for HAProxy L7 checks

This change add several configuration options to enable HTTP checks
to the HAProxy configuration, instead of the default TCP connection
checks (which continue to be the default). It also enables /healthcheck
endpoint for cinder-api on openstack releases >= ocata.

Closes-Bug: #1880610
Change-Id: I9d118f70fc1390be7b800ad20ae20e77818adac7

to the HAProxy configuration, instead of the default TCP connection
checks.

commit_message:
remove unused tripleo-common dep form nova-scheduler.

Previously tripleo-common was installed in nova-scheduler container so
that the additional scheduler filter for baremetal porisioning can be
used. However nova was already removed from undercloud and the library
is no longer used since wallaby.

Also the package pulls the transitive deps and removing it reduces
the container size significantly.

Change-Id: Icae34a6d3f6e9b2c5a02b3bf52eabba1712ec922
(cherry picked from commit 64aaa5cef1fa8cea0d39626c4834a787db214a59)
(cherry picked from commit faab92a88ebdbdf1e6528de764a4210f6ea0d646)

subject: Specify AXFR transfer timeout for dnspython v1.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-11-28 16:55:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/df4a14336d56dfb1cdefa8c5468faddbdb3aa0ee', 'message': "Specify AXFR transfer timeout for dnspython v1.

and eventlet requires updates too to be compatible with dnspython.

commit_message:
Specify AXFR transfer timeout for dnspython v1.

If we specify message timeout and do not specify AXFR transfer timeout
we face with error in dnspython v1:
https://github.com/rthalley/dnspython/issues/390
The bug was fixed in v2:
https://github.com/rthalley/dnspython/commit/9fbf9b223dc26262b1cf23f623f89283ee9c8375
It's risky to update dnspython to version 2 because there are changes in interfaces
and eventlet requires updates too to be compatible with dnspython.
So it's simpler to set transfer timeout.

Closes-Bug: 1940563
Change-Id: I052fb7ad90b4134ebe4c4e6a4784064c176eaaee

commit_message:
Show Network QoS rules one per line

The command "network show qos policy <qos>" now shows the QoS rules
printed one per line.

Example: https://paste.opendev.org/show/bgam6amfLUVheAMhDxB3/
Change-Id: I65a99da16056902a822804e29b2dd9376a72e091

commit_message:
Set cinder public_endpoint option

This ensures we use the correct pagination link URL when using HTTPS:

prior to this change I was seeing the following tempest failure:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "tempest/api/volume/test_volumes_list.py", line 366, in test_volume_list_details_pagination
    self._test_pagination('volumes', ids=self.volume_id_list, detail=True)
  File "tempest/api/volume/test_volumes_list.py", line 336, in _test_pagination
    self.assertEqual(next, response.response['content-location'])
  File "/home/stackhpc/.rally/verification/verifier-7cc15436-5efd-43f3-ba5d-91f049165e4d/.venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/testtools/testcase.py", line 411, in assertEqual
    self.assertThat(observed, matcher, message)
  File "/home/stackhpc/.rally/verification/verifier-7cc15436-5efd-43f3-ba5d-91f049165e4d/.venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/testtools/testcase.py", line 498, in assertThat
    raise mismatch_error
testtools.matchers._impl.MismatchError: !=:
reference = u'http://headinthe.cloud:8776/v3/157120e89e8742e5aab770e5000715dd/volumes/detail?limit=1&marker=4cc3b803-ad04-426d-89ac-5c872f2e7667'
actual    = 'https://headinthe.cloud:8776/v3/157120e89e8742e5aab770e5000715dd/volumes/detail?limit=1&marker=4cc3b803-ad04-426d-89ac-5c872f2e7667'

Where I have enabled SSL.

Change-Id: I1b27ee69759739afcfae00349f66621d7f2c7252
Closes-Bug: 2013184

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dash-separated config

Resolve the following warnings like the following being issued when
building the package:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

Change-Id: I4b75aac2c09b772f91e5ac9a4e77e9462f38bfd1
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix FIPS job - nslookup_target

This patch sets a zuul variable "nslookup_target" to 'opendev.org' to fix the FIPS jobs due to a new zuul-job change[1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/zuul/zuul-jobs/+/844704

Change-Id: Ic6b3a3c6d2f5b648f00813191c30d03132e31503
(cherry picked from commit 9ac645806613710ab03da7e1841537d1d28a6e8f)

commit_message:
Support ldap anonymous binding

We can support this simply by allowing ldap-user and ldap-password
configuration options to be optional.

Closes-Bug: #1762587

Co-authored-by: Vern Hart <vern.hart@canonical.com>

Change-Id: I2668d90a58aac9d103240dc67061612358a67150
(cherry picked from commit cb7fdb3527eda513554a521e8b594d36c168be3b)

commit_message:
remove unused tripleo-common dep form nova-scheduler.

Previously tripleo-common was installed in nova-scheduler container so
that the additional scheduler filter for baremetal porisioning can be
used. However nova was already removed from undercloud and the library
is no longer used since wallaby.

Also the package pulls the transitive deps and removing it reduces
the container size significantly.

Change-Id: Icae34a6d3f6e9b2c5a02b3bf52eabba1712ec922
(cherry picked from commit 64aaa5cef1fa8cea0d39626c4834a787db214a59)

commit_message:
[Quality Assurance] Transition Xena to EM

This transition the stable/xena branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch after the transition.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is April 20th, 2023.

Change-Id: I81293ebf710e2a7a0bc3e7c5018ea9ab67fbffce

commit_message:
Fix delete image tests.

Add wait until checkbox is in active state.

Fix edit_image_description_and_name test.
Add wait until the name text box is filled by default name (is not empty).
In the other case selenium write new name into text box faster than default
name is written there so default name then rewrite the new name.

Change-Id: I56803e19dd80180cc432ca872a28a7ee7f41290d
(cherry picked from commit I56803e19dd80180cc432ca872a28a7ee7f41290d)
(cherry picked from commit 25c107d710a03024243463be7e1d8404f1375232)

added_lines: _resource_page_header_locator = (by.By.CSS_SELECTOR, 'hz-resource-panel hz-page-header h1') _default_form_locator = (by.By.CSS_SELECTOR, 'div.modal-dialog') _search_field_locator = (by.By.CSS_SELECTOR, 'magic-search.form-control input.search-input') _search_button_locator = (by.By.CSS_SELECTOR, 'hz-magic-search-bar span.fa-search') _search_option_locator = (by.By.CSS_SELECTOR, 'magic-search.form-control span.search-entry') _search_name_locator_filled = ( by.By.XPATH, "//*[@id='imageForm-name'][contains(@class,'ng-not-empty')]" ) _search_checkbox_loaded = ( by.By.CSS_SELECTOR, "td .themable-checkbox [type='checkbox'] + label[for*='Zactive']" ) def wizard_getter(self): return self._get_element(*self._default_form_locator) def _get_row_with_image_name(self, name): self.wait_until_element_is_visible(self._search_checkbox_loaded) return self.images_table.get_row(IMAGES_TABLE_NAME_COLUMN, name) self.wait_till_spinner_disappears() def delete_images(self, images_names): for image_name in images_names: self._get_row_with_image_name(image_name).mark() confirm_delete_images_form = self.images_table.delete_image() confirm_delete_images_form.submit() self.wait_till_spinner_disappears() def edit_image(self, name, new_name=None, description=None, min_disk=None, min_ram=None, visibility=None, protected=None): row = self._get_row_with_image_name(name) confirm_edit_images_form = self.images_table.edit_image(row) self.wait_until_element_is_visible(self._search_name_locator_filled) if new_name is not None: confirm_edit_images_form.name.text = new_name if description is not None: confirm_edit_images_form.description.text = description if min_disk is not None: confirm_edit_images_form.min_disk.value = min_disk if min_ram is not None: confirm_edit_images_form.min_ram.value = min_ram if visibility is not None: if visibility is True: confirm_edit_images_form.visibility.pick('Shared') elif visibility is False: confirm_edit_images_form.visibility.pick('Private') if protected is not None: if protected is True: confirm_edit_images_form.protected.pick('Yes') elif protected is False: confirm_edit_images_form.protected.pick('No') confirm_edit_images_form.submit() def delete_image_via_row_action(self, name): row = self._get_row_with_image_name(name) delete_image_form = self.images_table.delete_image_via_row_action(row) delete_image_form.submit()

commit_message:
Add functional tests for add/update security service feature

This patch adds functional tests positives and negatives
for the new APIs methods `manila share-network-security
-service-update` and `manila share-network-reset-state`.
Also, we added and fixed tests related to
`manila share-network-security-service-add`.

Partially Implements: bp add-security-service-in-use-share-networks
Change-Id: I8c1b882f9c4fe40a14d50a4ebb7a40ff5c94bb46
Signed-off-by: Andre Beltrami <debeltrami@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Douglas Viroel <viroel@gmail.com>

added_lines: from manila_tempest_tests.common import constants from manila_tempest_tests.common import waitersfrom manila_tempest_tests import utils @decorators.idempotent_id('e71fb1dc-f6f8-49be-af7b-2c767a05503a') @tc.attr(base.TAG_POSITIVE, base.TAG_API_WITH_BACKEND) @utils.skip_if_microversion_not_supported("2.61") def test_share_network_reset_state(self): share_network = self.create_share_network( client=self.shares_v2_client, add_security_services=False) for state in (constants.STATUS_NETWORK_ACTIVE, constants.STATUS_NETWORK_ERROR, constants.STATUS_NETWORK_CHANGE): # leave it in a new state self.admin_shares_v2_client.share_network_reset_state( share_network['id'], status=state) waiters.wait_for_share_network_status( self.admin_shares_v2_client, share_network['id'], status=state)

commit_message:
Update the api-ref for 501 status codes

The API reference did not mention the 501 status code which provider drivers
may return if they do not implement a feature or option.
This patch updates the API reference to discuss the 501 status code.

Change-Id: Ic6f5cdf61edca130b874e940ba19637965d50f2e

commit_message:
Add note about removing leading tabs in ceph.conf files

As reported in bug #1914814, common ways to generate ceph config files
result in files that have leading tabs. These tabs make Kolla Ansible's
ini parser unhappy, so add a note to remind users to remove them.

Closes-Bug: #1914814
Change-Id: I4b06eae75bf238f2f093bfb76ba37c7f75dfd616
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/57/878557/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: Commands like ``ceph config generate-minimal-conf`` generate configuration files that have leading tabs. These tabs break Kolla Ansible's ini parser. Be sure to remove the leading tabs from your ``ceph.conf`` files when copying them in the below sections.

commit_message:
Remove workaround for nettle on tcib base image

This removes an earlier workaround for related-bug as it is now
causing new bug [1]

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2181513
Related-Bug: 1984237

(cherry picked from commit f48e4d0815eb7d207eabb114de7b234b5dc0f0ca)
Change-Id: Id5b53802840026ecebb36a444f6d5c2ea07d6688

deleted_lines: # TODO: Temporary pinning nettle to 3.8-3.el9, so it can be reinstalled from centos-9 repos. # nettle-3.8-3 is already installed in ubi9 image, but it conflicts with newer versions on gnutls # installed from centos-9 repos. This workaround can be reverted once ubi9.2 is released, which # should contain a newer version of gnutls with fixes to run under FIPS mode. # See: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2154924 and # https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1984237 - run: >- if [ '{{ tcib_release }}' == '9' ];then dnf -y install nettle-3.8-3.el9; fi

commit_message:
Remove unused identity options from tempest.conf

tempest does not support credential options such as username in
the identity section and these should be put into the auth section
instead.

Change-Id: I41d1994d7ac432233ebdc7bec8bd0a4c30ac7475

commit_message:
FFWD3: Refactor system upgrade

Upgrade should use system_upgrade.yaml that provides Leapp options.
Undercloud should use upgrade run with --system-upgrade and the yaml
file. After this run user has to reboot it.

Introduce tag for Controlplane and Compute upgrades separatel so we
can have different stages for them.

Cleanup unneeded code for Overcloud upgrade.

Change-Id: I573e01b8ce3060f78af5daa61e25fbc428d19518
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/66/873366/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
WIP Enabling tempest sec service conf in devstack plugin

Due to a zuul v3 limitation it`s necessary setup the security
services MultiOpt in the manila devstack plugin. The idea of this
patch is enabling those configurations for the Dummy and Container
drivers.

Depends-On: I8c1b882f9c4fe40a14d50a4ebb7a40ff5c94bb46
Change-Id: Id8381f3ec11c5f745ef95c7a936863a08ffa962d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/89/775289/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Option to setup the security service MultiOpt tempest configuration during # the devstack installation in the dummy and container driver with dhss-true MANILA_TEMPEST_SETUP_SEC_SERVICES=${MANILA_TEMPEST_SETUP_SEC_SERVICES:=False}

commit_message:
ci: MacvtapAgentTestCase.test_get_all_devices

The test was flake as it seems it was some time using mac of the veth1
or veth2. I plugged both and ensured that get all devices are finding
them.

Closes-Bug: #2013045
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com>
Change-Id: I93e388c066afad970b1c1fa43f98ff7ddff83761

commit_message:
[dhcp] Add DHCP dns_domain option from network properties

When network dns-domain option is set, add it to DHCP domain_name
option. This patch does not break default behavior when dns_domain
statically set up in CONF-file. But it extend functionality (dynamic
per-network DHCP dns_domain option)

Change-Id: I736dbad6fdb68c9221b309af4bafce780ae0a9fd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/12/878812/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[dhcp] Add dhcp option dns_domain from network properties

When network dns-domain option is set, add it to DHCP domain_name
option. This patch does not break default behavior when dns_domain
statically set up in CONF-file. But it extend functionality (dynamic
per-network DHCP dns_domain option)

Change-Id: I6fec0808e90a7ee7dc74434758d2468e737448cd

added_lines: @property def cluster_remote_public_addrs(self) -> Iterator[str]: """Retrieve remote addresses bound to remote endpoint. :returns: addresses bound to remote endpoints. :rtype: Iterator[str] """ return self._remote_addrs("public-bound-address") def db_public_nb_connection_strs(self) -> Iterator[str]: """Provide OVN Northbound OVSDB connection strings. :returns: OVN Northbound OVSDB connection strings. :rtpye: Iterator[str] """ return self.db_connection_strs( self.cluster_remote_public_addrs, self.db_nb_port ) @property def db_public_sb_connection_strs(self) -> Iterator[str]: """Provide OVN Southbound OVSDB connection strings. :returns: OVN Southbound OVSDB connection strings. :rtpye: Iterator[str] """ return self.db_connection_strs( self.cluster_remote_public_addrs, self.db_sb_port ) @property def cluster_public_addr(self) -> ipaddress.IPv4Address: """Retrieve local address bound to endpoint. :returns: IPv4 or IPv6 address bound to endpoint :rtype: str """ addresses = self._endpoint_public_bound_addresses() if len(addresses) > 1: logger.debug("Found multiple public ingress addresses, picking first one") address = addresses[0] elif len(addresses) == 1: address = addresses[0] else: logger.debug("Found no public ingress addresses") address = None return address @property def _endpoint_public_bound_addresses(self) -> ipaddress.IPv4Address: """Retrieve local address bound to endpoint. :returns: IPv4 or IPv6 address bound to endpoint """ addresses = [] for relation in self.charm.model.relations.get(self.relation_name, []): binding = self.charm.model.get_binding(relation) addresses.extend(binding.network.ingress_addresses) return list(set(addresses)) "public-bound-address": str(self.cluster_public_addr), "db_public_sb_connection_strs": self.db_public_sb_connection_strs, "db_public_nb_connection_strs": self.db_public_nb_connection_strs,

commit_message:
Add support for HAProxy L7 checks

This change add several configuration options to enable HTTP checks
to the HAProxy configuration, instead of the default TCP connection
checks (which continue to be the default). It also enables /healthcheck
endpoint for neutron-api.

Closes-Bug: #1880610

Change-Id: Ia820d8c2ca709d6b358b1c80d770624568d9a85b

commit_message:
Wait until SSHABLE for volume (de/at)tachment tests

Our qemu encryption test failed once with a volume detach timeout. We
suspect this to be caused by bug 1960346. Continue the work from [1]
by making that test wait for its instance to be SSHABLE before doing
anything else.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:wait_until_sshable_pingable+status:merged

Related-bug: 1960346
Change-Id: I1b360816d1ef143492eb827aada262553506061b

commit_message:
Fix mis-called function

In the rewrite from classic to operator, this function
was moved from a charmhelpers function to an apt lib
function and the signature should hve changed but did
not. This aligns with the correct method signature.

Change-Id: I8d0a82e979d3a9486191b0809dda139823a827d0

commit_message:
Fix pool creation with single LB create call

So far, creating a populated LB (or an LB tree) with non attached pools,
left the pools on PENDING_CREATE provisioning_state.

This patch adds the option of marking non attached pools to be active on
the MarkLBActiveInDB task.

Story 2010426
Task 46823

Change-Id: Ie5fb25e292461baca38499091e8f9b9a53e3ddcd

subject: Support --os-key option
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-10 23:46:58.000000000', 'files': ['manilaclient/tests/unit/test_shell.py', 'manilaclient/shell.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1999775-add-os-key-0cfc95c7b480df05.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-manilaclient/commit/7acf31c62b5b66899aef6c76800c2088d130da7a', 'message': 'Support --os-key option

keystoneclient Session expects as cert argument, one of the followings:
 * None (no client certificate),
 * a path to client certificate,
 * a tuple with client certificate/key paths.

The change updates manilaclient code to support the last case (ie:
os_cert and os_key are non-empty) with the --os-key option
and OS_KEY environment variable.

Closes-Bug: #1999775
Change-Id: I09313b7c55a5f9d4ec032a37e69a1d79db29d648
(cherry picked from commit 43943fdf670328e2fe606c07949190e9e45063ae)
(cherry picked from commit 8d9ea26f56b82044aa74fab669225df47143068e)
'}]
commit_message:
Support --os-key option

keystoneclient Session expects as cert argument, one of the followings:
 * None (no client certificate),
 * a path to client certificate,
 * a tuple with client certificate/key paths.

The change updates manilaclient code to support the last case (ie:
os_cert and os_key are non-empty) with the --os-key option
and OS_KEY environment variable.

Closes-Bug: #1999775
Change-Id: I09313b7c55a5f9d4ec032a37e69a1d79db29d648
(cherry picked from commit 43943fdf670328e2fe606c07949190e9e45063ae)
(cherry picked from commit 8d9ea26f56b82044aa74fab669225df47143068e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-manilaclient refs/changes/21/877021/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Support --os-key option and OS_KEY environment variable which allows to provide client cert and its private key separately.

commit_message:
Update block-storage-overview to reflect multiattach

According to https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/admin/volume-multiattach.html,single volume can be attached to multiple
instances simultaneously in active/active or active/standby scenarios.

Closes-Bug: #2004419
Change-Id: Iaa941ce8c730ceb518c0425196191bec0623c75b
Signed-off-by: Ajay Pal <ajay.pal.bisherwal@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/44/877544/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Prior to the Queens release, the Block Storage service did not provide a shared storage solution like NFS and you could attach a device to only one instance. However, with the introduction of Cinder multiattach, you can now attach a single volume to multiple instances simultaneously in active/active or active/passive scenarios.
deleted_lines: The Block Storage service does not provide a shared storage solution like NFS. With the Block Storage service, you can attach a device to only one instance.

subject: Revert "Ensure vlan network traffic is not centralized"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-24 15:51:34.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-2003455-dff0d0f00b5a18e2.yaml', 'neutron/common/ovn/constants.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/maintenance.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2ab2c922b11a7d7c55d7120d83532c3ad45d6255', 'message': 'Revert "Ensure vlan network traffic is not centralized"

This reverts commit 786d89fee0dca2914a0fce2dc39761c55c917f81.

Reason for revert:
As part of the reverted commit, the redirect-type=bridged flag was
enabled by default. However this have the side effect of also
decentralizing N/S traffic for geneve tenant networks, breaking the
VM connectivity on them when it must be centralized, i.e., when no
FIPs are associated to the VMs.

A new fix will be provided ASAP.

Change-Id: Id1992d47a70f940d932390a662b7961783a57710
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Ensure vlan network traffic is not centralized"

This reverts commit 786d89fee0dca2914a0fce2dc39761c55c917f81.

Reason for revert:
As part of the reverted commit, the redirect-type=bridged flag was
enabled by default. However this have the side effect of also
decentralizing N/S traffic for geneve tenant networks, breaking the
VM connectivity on them when it must be centralized, i.e., when no
FIPs are associated to the VMs.

A new fix will be provided ASAP.

Change-Id: Id1992d47a70f940d932390a662b7961783a57710
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/46/878446/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # FIXME(ltomasbo): Once Bugzilla 2162756 is fixed the # is_provider_network check should be removed vlan_net_ids = [vn['id'] for vn in vlan_nets if not utils.is_provider_network(vn)]

commit_message:
Revert "Ensure vlan network traffic is not centralized"

This reverts commit f83a97dea21c4d60cb2da16984fffcfb231fc239.

Reason for revert:
As part of the reverted commit, the redirect-type=bridged flag was
enabled by default. However this have the side effect of also
decentralizing N/S traffic for geneve tenant networks, breaking the
VM connectivity on them when it must be centralized, i.e., when no
FIPs are associated to the VMs.

A new fix will be provided ASAP.

Change-Id: I258cc439c70cfeae5b638ddd8e650dc2bf403c31

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I43690d01ca3246c22b8504f2d44ca6020e27fd44

commit_message:
tox 4 compatibility

Remove 'usedevelop = true' and 'skipsdist = true', the combination of
which now means we don't install dependencies. Also remove the
basepython setting, which is no longer needed since we don't have any
Python 2-first distros to worry about. Finally, remove the
lower-constraints job and we no longer test for these.

Change-Id: I5b4b8cc1facb6e18cf12d33ea8113d47a0a76235
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 12900da15b3163ac46504c9658f83e81b6849d82)

commit_message:
Revert "Nit: Change from dict to object notation"

This reverts commit feec91cec10ff080f124cfbb8ff7274bfb25ba8b. Turns out
this wasn't okay, sub_ports property on Trunk objects is a list of
dictionaries.

This also fixes unit tests to account for that.

Change-Id: I17f217a6f2bfc833019ba407c248564e74b663d2

commit_message:
parseactions: Use ArgumentError, not ArgumentTypeError

If you use the former, you get a pretty error message when there's a
failure. If you use the latter, you get an ugly traceback when used with
the '--debug' flag.

Without this change:

  $ openstack flavor create ... --property '' foo
  ...
  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "/tmp/venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/cliff/app.py", line 402, in run_subcommand
      parsed_args = cmd_parser.parse_args(sub_argv)
                    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
    File "/usr/lib64/python3.11/argparse.py", line 1862, in parse_args
      args, argv = self.parse_known_args(args, namespace)
                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
    File "/usr/lib64/python3.11/argparse.py", line 1895, in parse_known_args
      namespace, args = self._parse_known_args(args, namespace)
                        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
    File "/usr/lib64/python3.11/argparse.py", line 2107, in _parse_known_args
      start_index = consume_optional(start_index)
                    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
    File "/usr/lib64/python3.11/argparse.py", line 2047, in consume_optional
      take_action(action, args, option_string)
    File "/usr/lib64/python3.11/argparse.py", line 1971, in take_action
      action(self, namespace, argument_values, option_string)
    File "/tmp/venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/osc_lib/cli/parseractions.py", line 45, in __call__
      raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError(msg % str(values))
  argparse.ArgumentTypeError: Expected 'key=value' type, but got:
  clean_up CreateFlavor: Expected 'key=value' type, but got:

With this change:

  $ openstack flavor create ... --property '' foo
  ...
  usage: openstack flavor create [-h] [-f {json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN]
                                 [--noindent] [--prefix PREFIX] [--max-width <integer>]
                                 [--fit-width] [--print-empty] [--id <id>]
                                 [--ram <size-mb>] [--disk <size-gb>]
                                 [--ephemeral <size-gb>] [--swap <size-mb>]
                                 [--vcpus <vcpus>] [--rxtx-factor <factor>]
                                 [--public | --private] [--property <key=value>]
                                 [--project <project>] [--description <description>]
                                 [--project-domain <project-domain>]
                                 <flavor-name>
  openstack flavor create: error: argument --property: Expected 'key=value' type, but got:
  clean_up CreateFlavor:

Change-Id: Iebeac0af405a9847a4f9574b98888d417b5122dd
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
